longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the regulation and control of local vessels in Hong Kong or in the waters of Hong Kong and for other matters affecting local vessels, including their navigation and safety at sea (whether within or beyond the waters of Hong Kong).

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: accepted convention certificate (獲認可的公約證明書) means a certificate in the form prescribed by the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea signed in London on 1 November 1974, or any convention that replaces that Convention or any successor convention, as amended from time to time and as applicable to Hong Kong;(Replaced 10 of 2009 s. 50 and E.R. 3 of 2021)
aid to navigation (助航設備) means a lighthouse, beacon or buoy, and any cables, wires and other forms of communication apparatus connected or used with a lighthouse, beacon or buoy;
approved insurer (認可保險人) means a protection and indemnity association approved under any regulation made in relation to insurance under section 89; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

def.name: AuthorizedInsurer
def.leadIn: authorized insurer (獲授權保險人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) to carry on insurance business of the nature specified in class 12 in Part 3 of Schedule 1 to that Ordinance; (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 135)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an association of underwriters approved by the Insurance Authority under section 6 of that Ordinance to carry on insurance business of the nature specified in class 12 in Part 3 of Schedule 1 to that Ordinance; (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 135)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the society of underwriters known in the United Kingdom as Lloyd’s; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an approved insurer; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

def.name: AuthorizedOfficer
def.leadIn: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director and any public officer of the Marine Department of or above the rank of Marine Inspector Class II;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any police officer of or above the rank of Sergeant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any public officer authorized in writing in this behalf by the Director;

section.def: authorized surveyor (特許驗船師) means a person appointed under section 7(1) to be a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance;

cargo (貨物) means any goods, container, pallet, material and solid ballast, vessels’ stores, provisions and equipment, mail and passengers’ baggage, carried, or intended to be carried, in or on a vessel; (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 17)

def.name: CargoHandling
def.leadIn: cargo handling (貨物處理) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the loading of cargo on, or the unloading of cargo from, a local vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transfer of cargo within a local vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the transfer of cargo by a local vessel to or from another vessel; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the hoisting, lowering, moving and handling of cargo or any other thing in any manner, on or from a local vessel;

section.def: certificate of ownership (擁有權證明書), in relation to a local vessel, means its certificate of ownership issued under regulations made under section 89;

def.name: CodeOfPractice
def.leadIn: code of practice (工作守則) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a standard;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specification; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other documentary form of practical guidance;

section.def: collision regulations (《碰撞規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Signals of Distress and Prevention of Collisions) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. N);

coxswain (船長), in relation to a local vessel, means the person having for the time being the charge or command of the vessel; but where there is no such person or the vessel is in the charge or command of a person under the age of 16, it means the person whose name appears in the vessel’s certificate of ownership;

def.name: Crane
def.leadIn: crane (起重機) means any appliance equipped with mechanical means of hoisting and lowering a load and for transporting the load while suspended; and also all chains, ropes, swivels, or other tackle (down to and including the hook), used in the operation of the appliance; but does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a hoist block running on a fixed rail or wire;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a stacker or conveyer whereby a load is moved by means of a belt or platform; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an earth or mineral moving or excavating appliance not fitted with a grab; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

section.def: crew (船員) means the coxswain and any other person employed or engaged in any capacity on board a local vessel on the business of the vessel;
dangerous goods (危險品) has the meaning given by section 3 of the Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. F); (Replaced 29 of 2021 s. 60)

def.name: DeadVessel
def.leadIn: dead vessel (廢置船隻) means any local vessel, other than a laid-up vessel which has a written permission under section 66 which is in force, which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is, for any reason, unable to proceed under its own power;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is, for any reason, unable to manoeuvre with its own steering gear;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is, for any reason, unable to work its own anchors; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has any part of the hull structure removed, or under repair, which may affect the water-tight integrity of the vessel;

section.def: detention order (扣留令) means a notice under section 52(4);
Director (處長) means the Director of Marine;
domestic premises (住宅處所) means any premises used wholly or mainly for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit;

def.name: DwellingVessel
def.leadIn: dwelling vessel (住家船隻) means a local vessel which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is used, constructed or adapted principally for dwelling purposes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: tends to remain stationary in any area of the waters of Hong Kong;

def.name: DynamicallySupportedCraft
def.leadIn: dynamically supported craft (動力承托的航行器) means a passenger carrying vessel that is operable—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: at speeds such that the function V(gL)-1/2 is equal to, or greater than, 0.9:
Where, in consistent units—
“V” means maximum speed;
“g” means the acceleration force due to gravity;
“L” means the waterline length;

section.def: engine operator (輪機操作員), in relation to a local vessel, means the person who is in charge of the vessel’s machinery;
Government surveyor (政府驗船師) means a person appointed under section 5 of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369) to be a Government surveyor;
identity card (身分證) means an identity card within the meaning of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);
improvement notice (敦促改善通知書) means a notice under section 73(1);
Insurance Authority (保監局) means the Insurance Authority established under section 4AAA of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 135)

def.name: Junk
def.leadIn: junk (中式帆船) includes any vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of Chinese or other Asiatic build, construction or rig;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of Chinese or other Asiatic build and construction but of European rig; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of European build and construction, but of Chinese or other Asiatic rig,

def.continued: whether such vessel is of a sea-going type or not and whether mechanically propelled or not;

section.def: length overall (總長度), in relation to a local vessel, means the distance between the foreside of the foremost fixed permanent structure and the aftside of the aftermost fixed permanent structure of the vessel; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

lifting appliance (起重裝置) means a crane, winch, hoist, derrick boom, sheer legs, excavator, pile driver, pile extractor, fork lift truck or other self-propelled machine, and any other description of lifting appliance, derrick and mast bands, goose-necks, eyebolts, and all other permanent attachments to a derrick, mast or deck, used on a vessel for the purposes of hoisting or lowering in connection with works; (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 17)

lifting gear (起重工具) includes a chain, rope sling, canvas sling, net, tray, board, box, bull rope, snotter, can hook or other means of supporting cargo and attachments thereto including a ring, link, hooks, plate, clamp, shackle, swivel, eyebolt, bridle, beam, spreader, rope and wire, used on a vessel in connection with works; (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 17; 24 of 2005 s. 2)
local certificate of competency (本地合格證明書) means a certificate of competency issued under Part V;

def.name: LocalVessel
def.leadIn: local vessel (本地船隻) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any vessel used solely within the waters of Hong Kong, whether registered under the Merchant Shipping (Registration) Ordinance (Cap. 415) or in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any vessel regularly employed in trading to or from Hong Kong unless registered in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any vessel possessed or used for pleasure purposes in the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any vessel employed in sea fishing plying regularly in the waters of Hong Kong, or using the waters of Hong Kong as a base; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: registered in the Mainland of China or Macao;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: employed in trading to or from Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: issued with any certificate by a government authority of the Mainland of China or Macao permitting its trading to Hong Kong other than any accepted convention certificate; (Replaced 24 of 2005 s. 2. Amended 31 of 2025 s. 154)

section.def: marine construction (海上建造工程) means any construction or reclamation works, including dredging, drilling, pipe laying, buoy laying, cable laying and caisson construction, in which local vessels are used; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)
material (物料) includes construction material, waste material and debris; (Added 70 of 1999 s. 17)

mooring (繫泊設備) includes a mooring dolphin or post, buoy, pontoon, floating pier or other floating structure used for the mooring of vessels or to assist in the embarkation or disembarkation to or from vessels;
non-domestic premises (非住宅處所) means any premises other than domestic premises;
operating licence (運作牌照), in relation to a local vessel, means its licence issued under regulations made under section 89;

def.name: Owner
def.leadIn: owner (船東), in relation to a local vessel, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person or persons named in the vessel’s certificate of ownership as the owner of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of such a certificate, the person or persons owning the vessel;

def.name: Passenger
def.leadIn: passenger (乘客) means any person carried in a vessel other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the crew;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a child under 1 year of age;

def.name: PersonInChargeOfWorks
def.leadIn: person in charge of works (工程負責人) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a principal contractor or sub-contractor, if any, who contracts to carry out, or who carries out, any works; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person having for the time being the command or charge of any works being carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

def.name: PlaceOnLand
def.leadIn: place on land (陸上地方) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any premises, building or vehicle on land;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any building, structure or object erected or placed on the bed or shore of the sea; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: anything afloat (other than a vessel) if it is anchored or attached to the bed or shore of the sea;

def.name: PleasureVessel
def.leadIn: pleasure vessel (遊樂船隻) means any launch, yacht, inflatable vessel, junk, lorcha or other vessel that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: is possessed or used exclusively for pleasure purposes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is not let for hire or reward other than under the terms of a charter agreement in writing or hire-purchase agreement in writing,

def.continued: but does not include any launch, yacht, inflatable vessel, junk, lorcha or other vessel that has never been launched in the waters of Hong Kong;

section.def: pleasure vessel operator (遊樂船隻操作人), in relation to a pleasure vessel, means a person who is in charge of the vessel;
port (港口) means any area of the waters of Hong Kong which is declared to be a port under section 56 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313);
port facility (港口設施) means any aid to navigation, mooring or signal station;

principal contractor (總承判商) means a person who enters into a contract directly with the owner or coxswain of, or other person having control over, a local vessel to carry out any works; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

protection and indemnity association (保障及彌償組織) means an association established by shipowners to provide mutual indemnity for its members against losses and liabilities incident to marine adventure; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

def.name: Repairs
def.leadIn: repairs (修理), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any local vessel, means (except in section 74) any repairs, alterations or maintenance works on or to the vessel carried out by any person other than a member of the crew or the coxswain of the vessel or that involve or are likely to involve the safety of any person other than a member of the crew or the coxswain of the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any local vessel carrying dangerous goods, means (except in section 74) any repairs, alterations or maintenance works on or to the vessel capable of providing an ignition source, including those that involve welding, burning or the use of blow lamps, braziers or other devices using combustible materials; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

section.def: signal station (信號站) means a signal station as specified in regulations made under the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313);

def.name: Subcontractor
def.leadIn: sub-contractor (次承判商) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person who enters into a contract, express or implied, with a principal contractor to perform all or any part of the works which the principal contractor has contracted to perform; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who enters into a contract, express or implied, to perform all or any part of the works which a sub-contractor within the meaning of paragraph (a) has contracted to perform; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

section.def: tidal water (感潮水域) means any part of the sea or of a river within the ebb and flow of the tide at ordinary spring tides;
use of signals of distress regulations (《使用遇險訊號規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Use of Signals of Distress) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. O);

def.name: Vessel
def.leadIn: vessel (船隻) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any ship, junk, boat, dynamically supported craft, seaplane, or any other description of vessel used in navigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other description of vessel in Hong Kong or in the waters of Hong Kong not used in navigation or not constructed or adapted for use in navigation; (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 2)

def.name: Works
def.leadIn: works (工程) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: repairs to a local vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the breaking up of a local vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: cargo handling; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: marine construction. (Added 24 of 2005 s. 2)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), this Ordinance shall, except where otherwise specially provided, apply to all local vessels whether in or beyond the waters of Hong Kong.

Subject to subsection (3), this Ordinance shall, except where otherwise specially provided, apply to a local vessel referred to in paragraph (e) of the definition of local vessel in section 2 only while it is within the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Parts IV, V and VA shall not apply to a local vessel— (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: referred to in paragraph (e) of the definition of local vessel in section 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the time being used for any purpose by the Government.

subsection.content: This Ordinance shall not apply to any local vessel certified, under the provisions of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369), as a passenger ship.
Except where otherwise specially provided, nothing in this Ordinance shall derogate from the provisions of any other law. (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 3)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Local Vessels Advisory Committee, Subcommittees and Authorized Surveyors

section.name: s4
section.heading: Local Vessels Advisory Committee

subsection.content: There is hereby established a committee to be known as the Local Vessels Advisory Committee.

subsection.leadIn: The Committee shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Deputy Director of Marine who shall be the Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: two senior officers of the Marine Department appointed by the Director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a police officer nominated by the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the following persons appointed by the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in the ship building and repairing industry;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in naval architecture;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in ship survey work;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in the marine insurance industry;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in the field of seafarers’ training;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in the field of seafarers’ associations;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in cargo vessels’ operations;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in launch and excursion vessels’ operations;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in ferry vessels’ operations;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in river trade cargo operations;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in pleasure boating operations; and

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: a person who, in the opinion of the Director, has expertise in the fishing industry.

subsection.content: The members of the Committee appointed under subsection (2)(d) shall be appointed for a period of 3 years or for such lesser period as the Director may in any particular case determine and shall be eligible for reappointment.
Any member of the Committee appointed under subsection (2)(d) may, at any time by notice in writing to the Director, resign from the Committee.
Not less than half the members of the Committee shall form a quorum at any meeting of the Committee.

The Chairman of the Committee shall preside at all meetings of the Committee but, if the Chairman is absent from any meeting or any part thereof, he may nominate a member to preside in his absence as Chairman at the meeting or part thereof.

The Chairman of the Committee or any member presiding in his absence shall have a vote on all matters coming before the Committee; and in the case of an equality of votes he shall also have a casting vote.
The Director shall appoint an officer of the Marine Department to be the secretary of the Committee.
The secretary of the Committee shall furnish to the Director a record in writing of every meeting of the Committee.

Part VII of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) shall apply to the Committee and appointments to the Committee except in so far as that Part is inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance.
Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Director may make rules regulating the procedures at meetings of the Committee.
For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that rules made under subsection (11) are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Functions of Committee

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to any other provisions of this Ordinance, the Director may seek the advice of the Committee on any matter which is connected with or incidental to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the performance of his functions, or the exercise of his powers, under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the general regulation or control of local vessels in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The Committee shall advise the Director on any matter in respect of which its advice is sought under subsection (1).

section.name: s6
section.heading: Subcommittees

subsection.content: The Committee may establish subcommittees and appoint the members thereof, which may include persons who are not members of the Committee, and the Committee shall appoint a chairman for each subcommittee.
Any matter may be referred by the Chairman of the Committee to a subcommittee.
The Chairman of the Committee shall have the right to attend at any meeting of any subcommittee, whether or not he was appointed as a member of that subcommittee.
The Chairman of the Committee or the chairman of a subcommittee may convene a meeting of the subcommittee.
Not less than 1/4 of the members of a subcommittee shall form a quorum at any meeting of the subcommittee but, in any case, a quorum of the subcommittee shall not be less than 2 members.

Notwithstanding subsection (1), a subcommittee may co-opt additional persons as members of the subcommittee, and shall at all times furnish the Chairman of the Committee with particulars of all persons co-opted.

Upon the conclusion of its deliberations a subcommittee shall prepare a report covering all aspects of its work for the consideration of the Committee, which report shall be forwarded to the Chairman and the secretary of the Committee for inclusion on the agenda of the next meeting of the Committee.

subsection.leadIn: Part VII of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) shall apply to a subcommittee and appointments to the subcommittee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as if the subcommittee were a committee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except in so far as that Part is inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Authorization of surveyors

subsection.content: The Director may authorize in writing a person, or a person belonging to a class of persons, who is not a public officer to be a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance subject to such conditions, if any, as the Director thinks fit and specified in the authorization.

subsection.name: 1a
subsection.content: In considering the conditions (if any) to be imposed under subsection (1), the Director shall have regard to all relevant considerations, including but not limited to the experience and the competency of the person in carrying out the work of a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Added 24 of 2005 s. 4)

Where the Director refuses to authorize a person as a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance, or authorizes a person as a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance subject to conditions, he shall serve a notice in writing on the person setting out the reasons for the refusal or conditions, as the case may be.

Where the Director is satisfied that an authorized surveyor has contravened any of the conditions of his authorization, he may serve a notice in writing on the surveyor revoking the authorization and setting out the reasons for the revocation.
The Director may carry out an audit check of any survey carried out or any plan approved by an authorized surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Replaced 24 of 2005 s. 4)

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the Director may authorize a person as a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance subject to the condition that he is such a surveyor only in relation to a local vessel of which he is the owner.

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Recognition of government authority

subsection.content: The Director may recognize in writing any government authority for the purposes of carrying out any survey and approving any plan of any local vessel for the purposes of this Ordinance subject to such conditions, if any, as the Director thinks fit.

In considering the conditions (if any) to be imposed under subsection (1), the Director shall have regard to all relevant considerations, including but not limited to the experience and the competency of the government authority in carrying out the surveys and approving the plans of the local vessel.

Where the Director is satisfied that a recognized government authority has contravened any of the conditions imposed under subsection (1), he may serve a notice in writing on the authority withdrawing the recognition and setting out the reasons for such withdrawal.
The Director may carry out an audit check of any survey carried out or any plan approved by a recognized government authority for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Approval of codes of practice by Director

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (8), for the purpose of providing practical guidance in respect of any requirements under this Ordinance, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve and issue such codes of practice (whether prepared by him or not) as in his opinion are suitable for that purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve such codes of practice issued or proposed to be issued otherwise than by him as in his opinion are suitable for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Where a code of practice is approved under subsection (1), the Director shall, by notice in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code concerned and specify the date on which its approval is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify for which of the requirements under this Ordinance the code is so approved.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from time to time revise the whole or any part of any code of practice prepared by him under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve any revision or proposed revision of the whole or any part of any code of practice for the time being approved under this section,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of subsection (2) shall, with the necessary modifications, apply in relation to the approval of any revision under this subsection as they apply in relation to the approval of a code of practice under subsection (1).

subsection.content: The Director may at any time withdraw his approval from any code of practice approved under this section.

Where under subsection (4) the Director withdraws his approval from a code of practice approved under this section, he shall, by notice in the Gazette, identify the code concerned and specify the date on which his approval of it is to cease to have effect.

References in this Ordinance to an approved code of practice are references to that code as it has effect for the time being by virtue of any revision of the whole or any part of it approved under this section.

subsection.def: The power of the Director under subsection (1)(b) to approve a code of practice issued or proposed to be issued otherwise than by him shall include power to approve a part of such a code and, accordingly, in this Ordinance code of practice (工作守則) may be read as including a part of such a code.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall, before approving a code of practice under subsection (1) or any revision or proposed revision of the code under subsection (3), consult with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other interested persons as he thinks fit.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that different codes of practice may be approved under subsection (1) for different classes of local vessels, and may be so approved for the same or different requirements referred to in that subsection.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Use of approved codes of practice in proceedings under this Ordinance

subsection.content: A failure on the part of any person to observe any provision of a code of practice approved under section 8 shall not of itself render the person liable to any civil or criminal proceedings but where in any proceedings under this Ordinance a person is alleged to have contravened a requirement under this Ordinance, being a requirement for which there was an approved code of practice at the time of the alleged contravention, subsection (2) shall have effect with respect to such code in relation to those proceedings.

Any provision of a code of practice which appears to a specified body to be relevant to a requirement under this Ordinance alleged to have been contravened shall be admissible in evidence in the proceedings under this Ordinance concerned and if it is proved that there was at any material time a failure to observe any provision of the code which appears to that body to be relevant to any matter which it is necessary to prove in order to establish a contravention of such requirement, that matter shall be taken as proved in the absence of evidence that such requirement was in respect of that matter complied with otherwise than by way of observance of that provision.

In any proceedings under this Ordinance, a code of practice which appears to a specified body to be the subject of a notice under section 8 shall be taken to be the subject of such notice in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: proceedings under this Ordinance (根據本條例進行的法律程序) includes any criminal proceedings where a person is alleged to have committed an offence by reason of a contravention of a requirement under this Ordinance;

def.name: SpecifiedBody
def.leadIn: specified body (指明當局) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a magistrate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a court; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Administrative Appeals Board.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Certification and Licensing of Local Vessels

section.name: s10
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Part shall not apply to any local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: which is a pleasure vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from a place outside Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which does not remain in the waters of Hong Kong for more than 182 days out of 365 consecutive days;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: which is a vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: used exclusively for pleasure purposes;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not fitted with an engine; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the opinion of the Director, incapable of being fitted with an engine,

paragraph.continued: including but not limited to a canoe, beach pleasure hire boat, windsurfer and dinghy; (Replaced 24 of 2005 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is a licensed dwelling vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: which has never been launched.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Local vessel must be certificated

subsection.content: Every local vessel shall be certificated.

Where subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel commit an offence and each of them is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Ownership of local vessel

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a local vessel shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual who holds a valid identity card and who is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company or registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 30 of 2004 s. 3; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.content: The Director shall refuse to certificate a local vessel or to transfer its certificate of ownership to a new owner where the owner or transferee, as the case may be, is not a person referred to in subsection (1).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Certificated local vessel must be licensed

subsection.content: Every certificated local vessel shall be licensed except that this subsection shall not apply during any period when the vessel is the subject of a written permission under section 66 which is in force. (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 7)

Where subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel, his agent and the coxswain commit an offence and each of them is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Offences in relation to carrying of passengers

subsection.content: No unlicensed local vessel shall carry any passenger.
No licensed vessel shall carry any passenger unless the conditions of its operating licence permit the carriage of passengers.
No licensed vessel shall carry more passengers and crew than may lawfully be carried under the conditions of its operating licence.

If without reasonable excuse subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain commit an offence and each of them is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years, and to an additional fine at level 2 in respect of each passenger carried on the vessel in contravention of that subsection.

If without reasonable excuse subsection (3) is contravened, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain commit an offence and each of them is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year, and to an additional fine at level 1 in respect of each person carried in excess of the number that may lawfully be carried.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Additional licence fees

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the liability for an offence under section 13(2), the Director may, in the case of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel which is not licensed, require the owner of the vessel to pay, in addition to the prescribed licence fee for the issue of an operating licence, the prescribed licence fees which would have become payable if the vessel has been licensed from the date the vessel has been without a licence in contravention of section 13(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a local vessel the operating licence of which is not renewed from the date of expiry of the previous licence, require the owner of the vessel to pay, in addition to the prescribed licence fee for the renewal of the licence, the prescribed licence fees which would have become payable if the operating licence had been renewed from the date of expiry of the previous operating licence.

subsection.content: The owner of a local vessel may be required to pay the additional licence fees payable under subsection (1) in respect of a period prior to the issue or renewal of an operating licence whether or not he was the owner of the vessel during that entire period.
The additional licence fees under subsection (1) shall not be payable in respect of any period during which the operating licence of the vessel was terminated by notice to the Director.

section.name: s15A
section.heading: Additional fees

subsection.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a local vessel which was not licensed in accordance with any of the repealed regulations, require the owner of the vessel to pay a fee specified in subsection (2)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a local vessel which was not renewed from the expiry date of the licence in accordance with any of the repealed regulations, require the owner of the vessel to pay a fee specified in subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a local vessel is required to pay—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case described in subsection (1)(a), a fee which is equivalent to the prescribed licence fee for the issue of an operation licence for a period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: commencing on the date the vessel had been without a licence in contravention of the repealed section; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ending on the relevant day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case described in subsection (1)(b), a fee which is equivalent to the prescribed licence fee for the renewal of an operating licence for a period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: commencing on the expiry date of the licence; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ending on the relevant day.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) is without prejudice to the liability for an offence under section 13(2) and the liability to pay the additional licence fees under section 15.
The owner of a local vessel may be required to pay a fee payable under subsection (1) in respect of a period whether or not he was the owner of the vessel during that entire period.

subsection.leadIn: A fee under subsection (1) shall not be payable in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any continuous period exceeding 6 months during which the vessel had not been in use if the owner of the vessel produces evidence to that effect to the satisfaction of the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any period during which the licence of the vessel was terminated by notice to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant day (有關日期) means the day of the commencement* of this section;

repealed regulations (已廢除規例) means the Merchant Shipping (Launches and Ferry Vessels) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. E), the Merchant Shipping (Miscellaneous Craft) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. F) and the Merchant Shipping (Pleasure Vessels) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. G) repealed by this Ordinance;
repealed section (已廢除條文) means section 26 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313) repealed by this Ordinance.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Local Certificates of Competency and Inquiries

section.name: s16
section.heading: Local certificate of competency for persons employed as coxswains, etc.

subsection.content: The Director shall cause examinations to be conducted for the grant of local certificates of competency required to be held by persons employed as coxswains, engine operators or pleasure vessel operators on vessels, and shall appoint examiners for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may make rules providing for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue by the Director of local certificates of competency and the method of granting such certificates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the classes and grades of local certificates of competency and the endorsements appropriate to each class and grade;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the combining of 2 or more classes or grades of local certificate of competency in one document if appropriate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the addition or removal of endorsements on local certificates of competency;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the recognition of one type of local certificate of competency as equivalent to another type of local certificate of competency for all or specified purposes;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the procedure for applying for a local certificate of competency and for the conduct of examinations under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the subjects to be taken at such examinations or the manner in which those subjects are to be specified;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the standards of competency to be attained by candidates in order to pass such examinations and other conditions to be satisfied by candidates, and applicants for a local certificate of competency;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the requirements to be satisfied for a person to be exempted under subsection (5) from any part of such an examination;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the requirements to be satisfied for the grant of a local certificate of competency under subsection (4);

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the recognition of certificates of competency issued by the Director under any enactment or by the appropriate authority of another jurisdiction as equivalent, for all purposes or for purposes specified by the Director, to local certificates of competency required to be held by any person under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: the issue of a copy of any local certificate of competency which has been lost, destroyed, damaged or defaced;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the surrender of local certificates of competency upon their expiry or replacement;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: fees and forms, in relation to examinations conducted under subsection (1), the issue of local certificates of competency and recognition of certificates of competency as equivalent to local certificates of competency;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: generally, provisions in respect of local certificates of competency.

subsection.content: The Director may publish any rules made under subsection (2) in such manner as he thinks fit, and shall, on payment of such charge as the Director may determine, provide a copy of the rules to any person.

The Director may grant a local certificate of competency as a coxswain, engine operator or pleasure vessel operator to a person without requiring him to undergo the appropriate examination specified in the rules made under subsection (2), if the person produces to the Director suitable documentary evidence, or satisfies the Director in a manner specified in the rules, of his competence for the grant of such a certificate.

Without prejudice to subsection (4), the Director may exempt a person from undergoing any part of the appropriate examination for the grant of a local certificate of competency specified in the rules made under subsection (2), if the person satisfies the Director in a manner specified in the rules that he is qualified for such exemption.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under subsection (2) may direct that no local certificate of competency shall be granted to any person unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has reached such minimum age as may be specified therein; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has obtained such experience or performed such service on such class of vessel as may be specified therein.

subsection.content: Rules made under subsection (2) may direct that a local certificate of competency shall expire upon the holder’s attaining such age as may be specified therein but that it may thereafter be extended for such periods and in such manner as may be so specified.
For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that rules made under this section are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Inquiry into fitness or conduct of holder of local certificate of competency

subsection.leadIn: Where it appears to the Director that the holder of a local certificate of competency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is unfit to discharge his duties, whether by reason of incompetence or misconduct or for any other reason; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been seriously negligent in the discharge of his duties,

subsection.continued: the Director may cause an inquiry to be held and may, if he thinks fit, suspend, pending the outcome of the inquiry, the certificate and require the holder to deliver it to him.

subsection.leadIn: Where an inquiry is to be held under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the inquiry shall be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: held by one or more persons appointed by the Chief Justice; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: conducted in accordance with rules made under section 20 (which rules shall require the persons holding the inquiry to hold it with the assistance of one or more assessors); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the persons holding the inquiry shall for the purpose of the inquiry have the powers given by section 18(1).

content.leadIn: The persons holding an inquiry under this section and the assessors assisting them shall be remunerated at a rate which shall take account of the amount of work and time occupied by them upon the business of the inquiry and such remuneration shall be determined by the Secretary for Transport and Logistics either generally from time to time or specifically in any particular case: (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)
content.proviso: Provided that nothing in this subsection shall be construed to authorize the payment of remuneration to any person employed full time in any office of emolument under the Government.

subsection.leadIn: The persons holding an inquiry under this section into the fitness or conduct of the holder of a local certificate of competency—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: may make such order with regard to the costs of the inquiry or any part thereof (including witnesses’ costs) as they think just, and such order shall be enforced by them in the same way as an order for costs under the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall make a report on the case to the Director,

subsection.continued: and, if the certificate is cancelled or suspended, the holder, unless he has delivered it to the Director pursuant to subsection (1), shall deliver it forthwith to the persons holding the inquiry or to the Director.

subsection.content: Any costs which a person is ordered to pay under subsection (4)(b) may be recovered from him by the Director.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Powers of persons holding inquiry, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The persons holding an inquiry under section 17 may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make such examination and investigation as they consider necessary for the purpose of the inquiry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: require any person who they have reasonable cause to believe is able to give any information relevant to any examination or investigation under paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to attend at a place and time specified by the persons holding the inquiry;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to answer (in the absence of persons other than any persons whom the persons holding the inquiry may allow to be present and a person nominated to be present by the person on whom the requirement is imposed) such questions as the persons holding the inquiry think fit to ask;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to sign a declaration of the truth of his answers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: require the production of, and inspect and take copies of or of any entry in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any books or documents which by virtue of any provisions of the Merchant Shipping Ordinance (Cap. 281), the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313), the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369), the Merchant Shipping (Seafarers) Ordinance (Cap. 478) or this Ordinance are required to be kept;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other books or documents which they consider it necessary for them to see for the purposes of any examination or investigation under paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require any person to afford them such facilities and assistance with respect to any matters or things within that person’s control, or in relation to which that person has responsibilities as the persons holding the inquiry consider are necessary to enable them to exercise any of the powers conferred on them by this section.

subsection.content: A person shall be obliged to answer questions put to him under this section by the persons holding the inquiry, but if the answers might tend to incriminate him, and he so claims before answering the question, neither the question nor the answer shall be admissible in evidence against him in criminal proceedings other than proceedings for an offence under section 36 of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the answer, and the persons holding the inquiry shall, before asking any question under this section, inform the person concerned of the limitation imposed by this subsection in respect of the admissibility in evidence of the question and any answer given.

Any person who refuses to attend as a witness before any person having the powers specified in subsection (1), after having been required in the exercise of any such power to do so, or refuses or neglects to make any answer, or to give any return, or to produce any document in his possession or under his control, or to make or subscribe any declarations required by any such person in the exercise of any such power, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Re-hearing of and appeal from inquiries, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where an inquiry has been held under section 17, the Director may, on application by any person or otherwise, order the whole or part of the case to be re-heard, and shall do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if new and important evidence which could not be produced at the inquiry has been discovered; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there appears to him to be other grounds for suspecting that a miscarriage of justice may have occurred.

subsection.leadIn: Where a re-hearing is to be held under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the re-hearing shall be held by one or more persons appointed by the Chief Justice, who may provide for the re-hearing to be held by the persons who held the inquiry to which the order under subsection (1) relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the re-hearing shall be conducted in accordance with rules made under section 20; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 17(2)(b), (3), (4) and (5) shall, with any necessary modifications, apply to and in relation to the re-hearing as it applies to and in relation to an inquiry.

subsection.leadIn: Where the persons holding an inquiry have decided to cancel or suspend the local certificate of competency of any person or have found any person at fault, then, if no application for an order under subsection (1) has been made or such an application has been refused, that person or any other person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has an interest in the inquiry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has appeared at the hearing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is affected by the decision or finding; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is dissatisfied in point of law with the decision or finding,

subsection.continued: may appeal to the Court of First Instance.

subsection.leadIn: Where the persons holding a re-hearing under this section have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirmed (whether with or without variation) a decision at an inquiry to cancel or suspend the local certificate of competency of any person or a finding at an inquiry that any person was at fault; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: decided to cancel or suspend the local certificate of competency of any person or have found any person at fault,

subsection.continued: then, in either case, that person or any other person who—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: has an interest in the re-hearing;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: has appeared at the re-hearing;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: is affected by the decision or finding; and

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: is dissatisfied in point of law with the decision or finding,

subsection.continued: may appeal to the Court of First Instance.

subsection.leadIn: If on an appeal under subsection (3) or (4) the Court of First Instance is of the opinion that the decision or finding of the persons holding the inquiry or re-hearing was erroneous in point of law, the Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the appeal and give such directions in the matter as it thinks proper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remit the matter to those persons for determination in accordance with the Court’s decision on the point of law.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Rules as to inquiries, etc.

subsection.content: The Chief Justice may make rules for the conduct of inquiries under section 17 and for the conduct of any re-hearing under section 19.

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), rules made under this section may provide for the appointment and summoning of assessors, the manner in which any facts may be proved, the persons allowed to appear, and the notices to be given to persons affected.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Power to restore certificate, etc.
section.content: Where a local certificate of competency has been cancelled or suspended under this Part, the Director, if required to do so by the Court of First Instance or the persons holding the inquiry concerned, shall re-issue the certificate or, as the case may be, reduce the period of suspension and return the certificate, or shall grant a new certificate of the same or a lower grade in place of the cancelled or suspended certificate.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Offences relating to local certificates of competency

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes, assists in making or procures to be made any false representation for the purpose of procuring, either for himself or for any other person, a local certificate of competency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fraudulently uses a local certificate of competency or copy of a local certificate of competency which has been forged, altered, cancelled or suspended or to which he is not entitled; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fraudulently lends his local certificate of competency or allows it to be used by any other person,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: Where a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (1), the Director may cancel, or suspend for any period, the local certificate of competency in respect of which the offence is committed.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Surrender of local certificates of competency

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person fails to deliver a local certificate of competency as required under section 17(1) or (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the cancellation or suspension of a local certificate of competency under section 22, the holder of the certificate, or any person in possession of it, without reasonable excuse fails to deliver it to the Director on being required by him to do so,

section.continued: he commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s23A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part VA
section.def: class (類別), in relation to a local vessel, has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D);
type (類型), in relation to a local vessel, has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D).

section.name: s23B
section.heading: Application of Part VA

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Part shall apply to the following local vessels—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: local vessels which are certificated under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D) for the following classes and types—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Class I: ferry vessel, launch and multi-purposes vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Class II: transportation boat and tug; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: Class IV: all types; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all other local vessels which are required to be certificated under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: This Part shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any laid-up vessel which is the subject of a written permission under section 66; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: non-mechanically propelled vessels which do not exceed 4 metres in length overall.

section.name: s23C
section.heading: Obligation on users of vessels to be insured against third party risks

subsection.content: No owner, charterer or coxswain of a local vessel to which this Part applies may use, or cause or permit any other person to use, the vessel in the waters of Hong Kong unless there is in force in relation to the use of the vessel by such owner, charterer or coxswain or that other person, as the case may be, such policy of insurance as complies with section 23D.

subsection.leadIn: If an owner, charterer or coxswain contravenes subsection (1), he commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where the offence relates to the use of a local vessel permitted to carry no more than 12 passengers, to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.content: It shall be a defence to a charge under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to prevent the contravention to which the charge relates.

section.name: s23D
section.heading: Requirements in respect of policies of insurance

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 23C(1), a policy of insurance shall be a policy which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is issued by an authorized insurer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is expressed to be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: governed by the laws of Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: issued for the purposes of section 23C(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: insures such person, persons or classes of persons as may be specified in the policy in respect of any liability which may be incurred by him or them in respect of the death of or bodily injury to any person caused by or arising out of the use of local vessels in the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The liability covered by a policy of insurance required by subsection (1) shall include the liability for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: interest, costs and expenses indemnified under the policy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other costs and expenses incurred by the insured and recoverable from the insurer under the policy.

subsection.leadIn: A policy of insurance required by subsection (1) shall not be required to cover—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any contractual liability; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any liability in respect of any one accident or series of accidents arising out of the same event exceeding such amount as shall be specified by the Director under any regulation made under section 89.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding anything in any law, an authorized insurer issuing a policy of insurance for the purposes of section 23C(1) shall be liable to indemnify the persons or classes of persons specified in the policy in respect of any liability which the policy purports to cover in the case of those persons or classes of persons.
A policy of insurance which is issued for the purposes of section 23C(1) shall be governed by the laws of Hong Kong.

section.name: s23E
section.heading: Certain conditions of policies to be of no effect

subsection.leadIn: If a condition in a policy of insurance issued for the purposes of section 23C(1) provides that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no liability shall arise under the policy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any liability so arising shall cease,

subsection.continued: in the event of some specified thing being done or omitted to be done after the happening of the event giving rise to a claim under the policy, the condition shall be of no effect in connection with the liability mentioned in section 23D(1)(c).

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section shall be taken to render void any provisions in a policy of insurance requiring the person insured to repay to the authorized insurer any sums which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authorized insurer may have become liable to pay under the policy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have been applied to the satisfaction of the claims of third parties.

section.name: s23F
section.heading: Duty of insurers to satisfy judgment against persons insured in respect of third party risks

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a policy of insurance has come into operation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms of the policy cover a liability which the policy is required under section 23D(1)(c) to cover (being a liability covered by the terms of the policy); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: judgment in respect of the liability is entered against any person insured by the policy,

subsection.continued: the authorized insurer shall pay to the persons entitled to the benefit of the judgment any sum payable under the judgment in respect of the liability.

subsection.leadIn: A sum payable under subsection (1) shall include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any amount payable in respect of costs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any amount payable under any law relating to interest on judgments in respect of interest on the sum.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), an authorized insurer shall make payment under subsection (1) notwithstanding that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he may be entitled to avoid or cancel the policy of insurance concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he may have avoided or cancelled the policy.

subsection.content: The amount required to be paid by an authorized insurer under subsection (1) shall not exceed the amount specified by the Director in respect of the policy of insurance under any regulation made under section 89.

An authorized insurer shall be entitled to recover the excess from a person insured by a policy of insurance if the amount of the liability of the authorized insurer under this section exceeds the amount of the liability of the authorized insurer under the policy of insurance.

The Court of First Instance has power to hear and determine a claim against an authorized insurer in respect of his liability under subsection (1) notwithstanding that the authorized insurer is not within the jurisdiction of the Court.

def.name: LiabilityCoveredByTheTermsOfThePolicy
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), liability covered by the terms of the policy (保險單條款所承保的法律責任) means a liability which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is covered by the policy of insurance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: would be so covered but for the fact that the authorized insurer is entitled to avoid or cancel, or has avoided or cancelled, the policy.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)—
subsection.def: amount of the liability of the authorized insurer under the policy of insurance (獲授權保險人根據某保險單須負的法律責任的款額) means the amount for which the authorized insurer would, apart from this section, be liable under the policy of insurance in respect of the liability of the person described in that subsection;

amount of the liability of the authorized insurer under this section (獲授權保險人根據本條須負的法律責任的款額) means the amount for which the authorized insurer becomes liable under this section to pay in respect of the liability of the person described in that subsection.

section.name: s23G
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to duty of insurers under section 23F

subsection.leadIn: No sum shall be payable by an authorized insurer under section 23F(1) in respect of any judgment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless before or within 7 days after the commencement of the proceedings in which the judgment was given, the authorized insurer had notice of the bringing of the proceedings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so long as execution on the judgment is stayed pending an appeal.

subsection.leadIn: No sum shall be payable by an authorized insurer under section 23F(1) in connection with any liability, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the happening of the event which was the cause of the death or bodily injury giving rise to the liability, the policy of insurance was cancelled by mutual consent or by virtue of any provision contained in the policy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: before the happening of the event, the policy was surrendered to the authorized insurer or the policy holder made a statutory declaration stating that the policy had been lost or destroyed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: after the happening of the event, but before the expiration of a period of 14 days from the taking effect of the cancellation of the policy, the policy was surrendered to the authorized insurer or the policy holder made such a statutory declaration.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), no sum shall be payable by an authorized insurer under section 23F if in an action commenced before, or within 3 months after, the commencement of the proceedings in which the judgment was given, he has obtained a declaration that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: apart from any provision contained in the policy, he is entitled to avoid it on the ground that it was obtained by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the non-disclosure of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a representation of fact which was false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he has avoided the policy of insurance on the ground described in paragraph (a)(i) or (ii), he was entitled so to do apart from any provision contained in it.

subsection.content: An authorized insurer who has obtained a declaration referred to in subsection (3) shall not thereby become entitled to the benefit of that subsection as respects any judgment obtained in proceedings commenced before the commencement of that action unless he complies with the requirement specified in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement referred to in subsection (4) is that before or within 7 days after the commencement of that action, the authorized insurer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has given notice of the action to the person who is the plaintiff in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has specified in the notice the non-disclosure or false representation on which he proposes to rely.

subsection.content: Any person to whom notice of an action is given under subsection (5) shall be entitled, if he thinks fit, to be made a party to the action.

subsection.def: In this section, material (具關鍵性) means of such a nature as to influence the judgment of a prudent insurer in determining whether he will take the risk, and, if so, at what premium and on what conditions.

section.name: s23H
section.heading: Bankruptcy, etc. of insured persons not to affect certain claims by third parties

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a policy of insurance has been issued for the purposes of section 23C(1) in favour of any person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an event mentioned in section 2(1) or (2) of the Third Parties (Rights against Insurers) Ordinance (Cap. 273) happened in relation to any person insured by the policy,

subsection.continued: the happening of the event shall, notwithstanding anything in that Ordinance, not affect any such liability of that person as is required to be covered by a policy under section 23D(1)(c).

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall affect any rights against the authorized insurer conferred by the Third Parties (Rights against Insurers) Ordinance (Cap. 273) on the person to whom the liability was incurred.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an insured person has rights against an authorized insurer under a policy of insurance issued for the purposes of section 23C(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the rights are by virtue of section 2 of the Third Parties (Rights against Insurers) Ordinance (Cap. 273) transferred to and vested in a third party,

subsection.continued: the Court of First Instance has power to hear and determine a claim by the third party against the authorized insurer under the policy notwithstanding that the authorized insurer is not within the jurisdiction of the Court.

section.name: s23I
section.heading: Avoidance of restrictions on scope of policies covering third party risks

subsection.content: Where a policy of insurance has been issued for the purposes of section 23C(1) in favour of any person, so much of the policy as purports to restrict the insurance of the persons insured thereby by reference to any of the matters specified in subsection (2) shall be of no effect as respect such liabilities as are required to be covered by a policy under section 23D(1)(c).

subsection.leadIn: The matters referred to in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the age or physical or mental condition of persons in charge of the local vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the condition of the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of persons that the vessel carries;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the times at which or the areas within which the vessel is used;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the propulsion power or value of the vessel’s engine;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the carrying on the vessel of any particular apparatus;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the carrying on the vessel of any particular means of identification other than any means of identification required to be carried by or under any regulations made under section 89.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall require an authorized insurer to pay any sum in respect of the liability of any person otherwise than in or towards the discharge of that liability.

Any sum paid by an authorized insurer in or towards the discharge of any liability of any person which is covered by the policy of insurance by virtue only of this section shall be recoverable by the insurer from that person.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person uses, or causes or permits any person to use, a local vessel to which this Part applies in the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person uses, or causes or permits any other person to use the local vessel in such circumstances that under section 23C there is required to be in force in relation to the use of the vessel by that person or that other person, as the case may be, such a policy of insurance as complies with section 23D; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person is carried aboard the local vessel while the user is so using it,

subsection.continued: any antecedent agreement or understanding between them (whether intended to be legally binding or not) shall be of no effect to the extent specified in subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: Any antecedent agreement or understanding described in subsection (5) shall be of no effect to the extent that it purports or might be held—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to negative or restrict any such liability of the user in respect of persons carried in or upon the vessel as is required by section 23D(1)(c) to be covered by a policy of insurance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to impose any conditions with respect to the enforcement of any such liability of the user.

subsection.content: The fact described in subsection (8) shall not be treated as negativing any liability of the user in respect of persons carried in or upon the vessel as is required by section 23D(1)(c) to be covered by a policy of insurance.

The fact referred to in subsection (7) is that a person carried aboard a local vessel as described in subsection (5)(c) has willingly accepted as his the risk of negligence on the part of the user of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: references to a person being carried aboard a vessel include references to a person embarking or disembarking from the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to any antecedent agreement is to one made at any time before the liability arose.

section.name: s23J
section.heading: Duty of person against whom claims are made to give information as to insurance

subsection.leadIn: Any person against whom a claim is made in respect of any such liability as is required to be covered by a policy of insurance under section 23D(1)(c) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on demand by or on behalf of the person making the claim, state—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: whether or not he would have been so insured if the authorized insurer had not avoided or cancelled the policy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he was or would have been so insured, give particulars with respect to that policy.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, any person fails to comply with subsection (1), or wilfully makes any false statement in reply to any such demand, he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s23K
section.heading: Requirements as to production of policy of insurance

subsection.content: This section applies to a local vessel to which this Part applies which is being used in the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Upon a requirement made by an authorized officer, the owner, charterer or coxswain of a vessel shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce for inspection a policy of insurance that complies with this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: within 5 days after the date on which the requirement was made, produce in person at a place specified by the officer—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the relevant policy of insurance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: satisfactory evidence that such policy of insurance had been in effect on that date,

paragraph.continued: to an authorized officer for inspection.

subsection.content: If the owner, charterer or coxswain contravenes subsection (2), he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Power to give directions
section.leadIn: The Director may give to an owner or his agent or to a coxswain of, or other person who appears to the Director to have control over, a local vessel such directions as he thinks fit in any particular case—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for controlling the vessel when entering or leaving the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for controlling the navigation and movement of the vessel in the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: as to the place and manner in which the vessel shall be berthed, moored, anchored or secured;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the removal of the vessel from any berth, mooring or anchorage to another berth, mooring or anchorage;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prohibiting the berthing, mooring or anchoring of the vessel in any particular place;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for ensuring the safety of, or preventing the outbreak of fire on, the vessel in the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: for preventing pollution of the waters of Hong Kong.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Power to give directions by notice in the Gazette

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of section 24, the Director may, by notice in the Gazette, give to an owner or his agent or to a coxswain of, or other person who appears to the Director to have control over, any vessel belonging to a class, type or description of vessel specified in the notice such directions as he thinks fit in respect of any matter in relation to which the Director may give directions under that section.

A notice under subsection (1) which has not been repealed, or which has not expired, on or before the effluxion of the period of 6 months immediately following the day on which it is published in the Gazette shall expire on the day immediately following that period.

subsection.leadIn: It is hereby declared that a notice under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subsidiary legislation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be in the same terms as another notice under that subsection where that first-mentioned notice is to come into operation upon or after the expiration of that second-mentioned notice.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of section 84(5) or (6), subsections (1), (2), (3) and (4) of that section shall not apply to a direction given in a notice under subsection (1).

section.name: s26
section.heading: Closure of waters

subsection.content: Where the Director reasonably believes that it is necessary in the interests of safety to close any area of the waters of Hong Kong to all vessels, or to any vessel belonging to any class, type or description of vessel, he may, by notice in the Gazette, close that area to such vessels or vessel, as the case may be.

A notice under subsection (1) which has not been repealed, or which has not expired, on or before the effluxion of the period of 6 months immediately following the day on which it is published in the Gazette shall expire on the day immediately following that period.

subsection.leadIn: It is hereby declared that a notice under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
