paragraph.content: is subsidiary legislation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be in the same terms as another notice under that subsection where that first-mentioned notice is to come into operation upon or after the expiration of that second-mentioned notice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not apply to any vessel which is being used for any fire services, ambulance, police, customs and excise or Marine Department purpose if compliance with the notice is likely to hinder the use of that vessel for that purpose.

subsection.content: If without reasonable excuse a vessel the subject of a notice under subsection (1) enters an area of the waters of Hong Kong the subject of that notice, the coxswain of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Application of collision regulations and use of signals of distress regulations

subsection.content: Subject to any special provision in or under this Ordinance, the collision regulations and the use of signals of distress regulations shall apply to all local vessels wherever they may be, and shall, for the purpose of their application by virtue of this section, be read and construed as if references to “ships” were references to “local vessels within the meaning of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548)” and references to “registered in Hong Kong” were deleted.

If any of the collision regulations is contravened by a local vessel, the owner of the vessel, his agent, the coxswain and any person for the time being responsible for the conduct of the vessel shall each be guilty of an offence and liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.
It shall be a defence to a charge under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable precautions to prevent the contravention to which the charge relates.

subsection.leadIn: If the coxswain of a vessel uses or displays or causes or permits any person under his authority to use or display—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any signal prescribed by the collision regulations except in the circumstances and for the purposes prescribed by the use of signals of distress regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any private signal, whether registered or not, which is liable to be mistaken for any signal prescribed by the collision regulations,

subsection.continued: he commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and shall further be liable to pay compensation for any labour undertaken, risk incurred or loss sustained in consequence of the signal having been supposed to be a signal of distress; and that compensation may, without prejudice to any other remedy, be recovered in the same manner as salvage.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Port clearance to be obtained before departure

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no local vessel shall depart the waters of Hong Kong unless there is in relation to the vessel a valid port clearance in writing obtained in the prescribed manner.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to any vessel for the time being used for any purpose by the Government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any vessel of a class that is exempted by the Director by notice in the Gazette from the operation of this section; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to any vessel that is obliged to leave any port or the waters of Hong Kong due to weather conditions, or other circumstances beyond the control of its coxswain, in the interests of safety of the vessel, its cargo, crew or passengers.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened, the coxswain commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Assistance to be rendered in event of collision

subsection.leadIn: Where two vessels collide and either of those vessels is a local vessel it shall be the duty of the coxswain or person in charge of the local vessel involved in the collision, if and so far as he can do so without danger to his own vessel, crew and passengers, if any—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to render to the other vessel, the coxswain, crew and passengers, if any, such assistance as may be practicable and may be necessary to save them from any danger caused by the collision, and to stay by the other vessel until he has ascertained that there is no need of further assistance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to give to the coxswain or person in charge of the other vessel—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of his vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of the port to which it belongs; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the names of the ports from which it comes and to which it is bound.

subsection.content: If the coxswain or person in charge of any vessel involved in a collision fails without reasonable cause to comply with subsection (1), he commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Unseaworthy vessels
section.content: Any owner, agent or coxswain who permits a local vessel to operate while it is in an unseaworthy or unsafe condition, whether by reason of overloading or from any other cause whatsoever, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Cutting of moorings
section.content: Any person, other than the Director or a person authorized by him, who without lawful excuse cuts a mooring or fastening of a local vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Endangering the safety of others
section.leadIn: Any person (wherever he may be) who by any unlawful act, or in any manner whatsoever without reasonable excuse, endangers or causes to be endangered the safety of any person conveyed in or being in or upon any local vessel or in the sea commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 4 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Scuttling or beaching vessel
section.leadIn: Any person who, by any unlawful act or in any manner whatsoever without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disables, abandons, scuttles or beaches any local vessel within the waters of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to notify the Director thereof within 24 hours immediately following that disablement, abandonment, scuttling or beaching,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 4 years; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Use of port facilities

subsection.content: Subject to any other provisions of this Ordinance, no person shall use a port facility otherwise than for the purpose for which it is provided.
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Damage, etc., to aids to navigation

subsection.leadIn: Any person who wilfully or negligently—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: removes, alters, damages, destroys, or interferes with, any aid to navigation or mooring; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes fast to any aid to navigation,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.content: If an offence under subsection (1) is committed by a person on or in respect of a local vessel, then, in addition to that person, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel commit an offence and each of them is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Liability for damage to port facilities, etc.

subsection.content: Where any damage is caused by a local vessel to any port facility, pier, breakwater or other property owned by the Government, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel shall, without prejudice to the liability for an offence under this Ordinance, be jointly and severally liable for any loss arising out of the damage to the extent that such loss is attributable to any fault on the part of the vessel or to any wilful or negligent act of any person on the vessel.
Such loss may be recovered by the Director as a civil debt.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: approved code (《守則》) means a code of practice issued under section 45A; (Added 70 of 1999 s. 19)

def.name: MachineryEquipmentOrAppliance
def.leadIn: machinery, equipment or appliance (機械、裝備或裝置), in the case of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: repairs to a local vessel, means any machinery, equipment or appliance provided or used for that purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the breaking up of a local vessel, means any machinery, equipment or appliance provided or used for that purpose;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: cargo handling, means any lifting appliance or lifting gear provided or used for that purpose;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: marine construction, means any machinery, equipment or appliance provided or used for that purpose. (Added 70 of 1999 s. 19. Amended 24 of 2005 s. 10)

section.name: s38
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Part shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel which is outside the waters of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: repairs to, or the breaking up of, a local vessel which is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in a dock other than a floating dock; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on a slip or mechanical lift.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Appointment of inspectors
section.content: The Director shall appoint such persons as he thinks fit to be inspectors for the purposes of this Part.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Powers of Director and inspectors

subsection.leadIn: The Director and an inspector shall have power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any reasonable time (or, in a situation which in the opinion of the Director or an inspector is or may be dangerous, at any time) to board any local vessel within the waters of Hong Kong which he has reason to believe it is necessary to board for the purposes of this Part, and for the purpose of boarding any such vessel which is floating alongside any premises at a seawall or pier, to enter such premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to take with him such persons as may be necessary to assist him in the exercise of his powers, or performance of his duties, under this Part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to inspect and examine any local vessel on or to which any works are being carried out;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to make such examination and inquiry as may be necessary to ascertain that safe working conditions obtain and that the provisions of this Part are complied with;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to investigate any accident involving any works or injury to any person arising out of or in the course of carrying out any works;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to require the production of any register, certificate or other document required to be kept in pursuance of regulations made under section 89 and to inspect and copy any of them or any entry in them; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to require the posting of any notice in pursuance of regulations made under section 89 or any notice related to works, machinery, equipment or appliances, or the safety of persons employed in carrying out any works.

subsection.content: The owner or coxswain of, or other person having control over, a local vessel shall furnish such safe means required by the Director or an inspector as are necessary for the purposes of boarding, inspection, examination, investigation, or otherwise for the exercise of his powers under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse fails to comply with any requirement of the Director or an inspector in pursuance of this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse fails to produce any register, certificate or other document which he is required in pursuance of this Part to produce; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse withholds any information as to who is the owner or coxswain of, or person having control over, a local vessel, or the owner of any machinery, equipment or appliance provided or used for the carrying out of any works,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 20)

section.name: s41
section.heading: Restriction on carrying out repairs or breaking up of local vessels

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (1A) and (2), no owner or coxswain of, or other person having control over, a local vessel shall, except with the written permission of the Director, carry out, or cause to be carried out, any repairs to, or break up, the vessel. (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 21)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to any local vessels of 50 metres or less in length unless the Director gives written notification to the person in charge of works that subsection (1) applies to that vessel. (Added 70 of 1999 s. 21)
The Director may, by notice in the Gazette, specify any type of repairs to a local vessel in respect of which permission under subsection (1) is not required.
Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 21)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Safe atmosphere

subsection.leadIn: Where a local vessel is being repaired or broken up, the person in charge of works shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide or use, or cause to be provided or used, any machinery, equipment or appliance that is capable of providing an ignition source; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out, or cause to be carried out, any works that involve welding or burning, the use of blow lamps, braziers or other devices using combustible materials,

subsection.continued: in an atmosphere containing flammable vapours, flammable gases or explosive dusts.

subsection.content: A person in charge of works who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year. (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 22)

section.name: s43
section.heading: Directions regarding repairs or breaking up of local vessels

subsection.leadIn: The Director may direct any person who, in the opinion of the Director, is the owner or coxswain of a local vessel, or who claims or appears to the Director to exercise control over a local vessel, that is to be repaired or broken up or is being repaired or broken up, or who is in charge of the repairs or the breaking up of a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to remove the vessel to a position or place within the waters of Hong Kong specified by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to comply with such safety requirements as may be specified by the Director generally or in any particular case;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to comply with any other requirements which may be specified by the Director in respect of the manner in which the vessel may be repaired or broken up;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of the breaking up of the vessel, to give security, in cash or otherwise, in such amount as the Director may consider necessary to ensure the effective breaking up and complete removal of the vessel.

subsection.content: Any person who fails to comply with any direction given to him under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months, and to an additional fine of $2,000 for each day during which such failure to comply continues after notice requiring compliance with the direction has been served by the Director on such person. (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 23)

section.name: s44
section.heading: Prohibition against use of dangerous equipment, etc.

subsection.content: A person in charge of works shall not provide or use, or cause to be provided or used, any machinery, equipment or appliance for the carrying out of the works if the machinery, equipment or appliance is in such a condition or so constructed that it cannot be used without unnecessary risk of accident or bodily injury.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director or an inspector has reasonable grounds to believe that any machinery, equipment or appliance provided or used for the carrying out of any works is in such a condition or so constructed that it cannot be used without unnecessary risk of accident or bodily injury, the Director or inspector may give directions to the person in charge of works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibiting the use of the machinery, equipment or appliance, or if it is capable of repair or alteration, prohibiting its use until it is repaired or altered as specified in the direction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring him to take such other steps as may be specified in the directions for remedying the unnecessary risk of accident or bodily injury.

subsection.leadIn: A person in charge of works who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with any direction given to him under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months, and to an additional fine of $2,000 for each day during which such failure to comply continues after notice requiring compliance with the direction has been served by the Director or an inspector on such person. (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 24)

section.name: s45
section.heading: Prohibition against carrying out works in dangerous conditions

subsection.content: A person in charge of works shall not carry out, or cause to be carried out, any works in a condition or manner that does not provide adequately against unnecessary risk of accident or bodily injury.

If the Director or an inspector has reasonable grounds to believe that any works are being carried out in a condition or manner that does not provide adequately against unnecessary risk of accident or bodily injury, the Director or inspector may give directions to the person in charge of the works requiring him to take such steps as may be specified in the directions for remedying the unnecessary risk of accident or bodily injury.

subsection.leadIn: A person in charge of works who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with any direction given to him under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months, and to an additional fine of $2,000 for each day during which such failure to comply continues after notice requiring compliance with the direction has been served by the Director or an inspector on such person. (Amended 70 of 1999 s. 25)

section.name: s45A
section.heading: Code of practice

subsection.content: For the purpose of providing practical guidance in respect of any one or more of the requirements of this Part or of regulations made under this Ordinance, the Director may issue such codes of practice (whether prepared by the Director or not) as the Director considers appropriate.
The Director may amend or revoke a code of practice issued by him under subsection (1).

Where the Director exercises a power under subsection (1) or (2), he shall as soon as may be reasonably practicable publish notice thereof in the Gazette and the notice shall be in such form as the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A failure by any person to observe a provision of an approved code shall not of itself cause him to incur any criminal liability, but where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in any criminal proceedings the defendant is alleged to have committed an offence either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by reason of a contravention of or a failure to comply with, whether by act or omission, this Ordinance or regulations under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by reason of a failure to discharge or perform a duty imposed by this Ordinance or such regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the matter to which the alleged contravention or failure relates is one to which, in the opinion of the court, an approved code relates,

subsection.continued: then subsection (5) shall apply as regards to the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: In any criminal proceedings to which this subsection applies, the following, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compliance with a provision of an approved code found by the court to be relevant to a matter to which a contravention or failure alleged in the proceedings relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contravention of or a failure to comply with, whether by act or omission, any such provision so found,

subsection.continued: may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or to negative any liability which is in question in the proceedings.

subsection.content: In any criminal proceedings, any document which purports to be a copy of a particular approved code shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be regarded by the court as being a true copy of that code.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: dark smoke (黑煙) means smoke which would appear to be as dark as, or darker than, shade 2 on a specified chart; (Added 13 of 2014 s. 5)
mixture containing oil (含油混合物) means any mixture of oil with water or with any other substance, and any waste consisting of or arising from oil;

def.name: Occupier
def.leadIn: occupier (佔用人), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a place on land, if it has no occupier, means the owner thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vehicle, means the person in charge of the vehicle and not the occupier of the land on which the vehicle stands;

section.def: oil (油) means oil of any description, spirit produced from oil of any description and coal tar;
smoke (煙霧) includes soot, ash, grit and gritty particles emitted in smoke or steam; (Amended 13 of 2014 s. 5)

specified chart (指明圖表) means a shade chart of the type known on the commencement date* of the Shipping Legislation (Control of Smoke Emission) (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (13 of 2014) as a Ringelmann Chart and includes a Micro-Ringelmann Chart. (Added 13 of 2014 s. 5)

section.name: s47
section.heading: Discharge of oil into the waters of Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: If any oil or mixture containing oil is discharged into the waters of Hong Kong, then the following commit an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person by whom the oil or mixture containing oil is so discharged or caused to be discharged; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether or not the person referred to in paragraph (a) has been charged with an offence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the discharge is from a local vessel, the owner and the coxswain of the vessel, unless the owner or coxswain, as the case may be, proves that the discharge took place and was caused as mentioned in subparagraph (ii);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the discharge is from a local vessel but takes place in the course of a transfer of oil to or from another vessel or a place on land and is caused by the act or omission of any person in charge of any apparatus in that other vessel or that place, the owner and the coxswain of that other vessel or, as the case may be, the occupier of that place;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the discharge is from a place on land, the occupier of that place, unless he proves that the discharge was caused by the act of a person who is in that place without the permission (express or implied) of the occupier;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the discharge takes place otherwise than as mentioned in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii) and is the result of any operations for the exploration of the seabed and subsoil or the exploration of their natural resources, the person carrying on the operations.

subsection.content: Reference in subsection (1) to the discharge of oil or mixture containing oil, or to its being discharged, from a local vessel or place on land includes a reference to the escape of the oil or mixture containing oil, or (as the case may be) to its escaping, from that vessel or place on land.
Any person who commits an offence under this section is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Defences under section 47

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 47 as the owner or coxswain of a local vessel it shall be a defence to prove that the oil or mixture containing oil was discharged for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securing the safety of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: preventing damage to the vessel or its cargo; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: saving life,

subsection.continued: unless the court is satisfied that the discharge of the oil or mixture containing oil was not a reasonable step to take in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged as mentioned in subsection (1) it shall also be a defence to prove—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the oil or mixture containing oil escaped in consequence of damage to the local vessel and that as soon as practicable after the damage occurred all reasonable steps were taken for preventing, or (if it could not be prevented) for stopping or reducing, the escape of the oil or mixture containing oil; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the oil or mixture containing oil escaped by reason of leakage, that neither the leakage nor any delay in discovering it was due to want of reasonable care, and that as soon as practicable after the escape was discovered all reasonable steps were taken for stopping or reducing it.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Duty to report discharge of oil into Hong Kong waters

subsection.leadIn: If any oil or mixture containing oil—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is discharged from a local vessel into the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is found to be escaping or to have escaped from a local vessel into any such waters; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is found to be escaping or to have escaped into any such waters from a place on land,

subsection.continued: the owner or coxswain of the vessel, or the occupier of the place on land, as the case may be, shall forthwith report the occurrence to the Director.

subsection.content: A report made under subsection (1) by the owner or coxswain of the local vessel shall state whether the occurrence falls within paragraph (a) or (b) of that subsection.
Any person who fails to make a report as required by this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Discharges under the Water Pollution Control Ordinance
section.content: No offence under section 47 is committed by, and no obligation arises under section 49 on the part of, any person who makes a discharge or deposit of oil or a mixture containing oil under and in accordance with a licence for the purposes of the Water Pollution Control Ordinance (Cap. 358).

section.name: s51
section.heading: Emission of dark smoke from local vessel

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no local vessel in the waters of Hong Kong shall emit dark smoke for 3 minutes or more continuously at any one time. (Amended 13 of 2014 s. 6)
Subsection (1) shall not apply to the emission of dark smoke in circumstances affecting the safety of life or of the vessel. (Amended 13 of 2014 s. 6)
If subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the local vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel each commits an offence. (Amended 13 of 2014 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Each person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the person has previously committed the offence in relation to the vessel, to a fine at level 4. (Added 13 of 2014 s. 6)

section.name: s51A
section.heading: Inspection of local vessel emitting dark smoke

subsection.content: If an authorized officer has reasonable grounds for suspecting that section 51(1) has been contravened in relation to a local vessel, the officer may direct the owner or coxswain of the vessel, or the owner’s agent, to deliver the vessel, within the time and at the place specified in the direction, to the Director for ascertaining whether dark smoke emits from the vessel.
A person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a direction given to that person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Seizure, Removal and Detention of Local Vessels

section.name: s52
section.heading: Seizure, etc. of local vessel

def.name: SpecifiedGround
def.leadIn: In this section, specified ground (指明理由), in relation to a local vessel, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the vessel is so situated or in such a condition that it—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: endangers the safety of persons, other vessels or property; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: poses a hazard to the environment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vessel is not certificated or licensed or is not the subject of a written permission under section 66 which is in force or a permit referred to in section 89(2) which is in force; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the owner of the vessel does not comply, or no longer complies, with section 12(1).

subsection.content: An authorized officer may seize and remove or cause to be removed from any place or premises or from any part of the waters of Hong Kong any local vessel in respect of which he has reason to believe that a specified ground is applicable to the vessel.
Subject to section 54, a vessel removed under subsection (2) may be detained by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall, as soon as practicable after detaining a vessel under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a notice in the specified form in the Chinese and English languages on the owner of the vessel or his agent or the person who appears to the Director to exercise control over the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where no such owner, agent or person can be found, or whose identity is not known, publish that notice in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Gazette; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Chinese language newspaper and an English language newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A detention order shall specify in relation to the local vessel the subject of the order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names (if known to the Director) of the persons whom the Director believes to be the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name (if known to the Director) of the person whom the Director believes to be the owner or otherwise entitled to the possession of any cargo or other things on board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a description of the vessel and the place at which it was seized;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a description of the cargo and other things on board;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the reason for the detention;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the position where the vessel will be secured, anchored or moored during its detention;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the action required to secure the release of the vessel including the costs of any action taken or caused to be taken by the Director under this section in respect of the vessel; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a reasonable period within which the release of the vessel may be effected.

subsection.content: For the purpose of subsection (5)(g), the costs of any action taken or caused to be taken under this section shall include all disbursements and other expenses incurred thereby by the Director.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Detained vessels may only be moved as permitted, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A local vessel the subject of a detention order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be moved as directed in writing by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be otherwise moved except in accordance with the permission in writing of the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 4 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Revocation of detention orders, etc.

subsection.content: The Director may revoke a detention order at any time.

The Director shall, upon the request in writing of the owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain, revoke a detention order of which that vessel is the subject if the Director is satisfied that the action referred to in section 52(5)(g) specified in the order has been carried out.

Where the period referred to in section 52(5)(h) specified in a detention order expires without the Director being satisfied that the action referred to in section 52(5)(g) specified in that order has been carried out, then section 56 shall, with all necessary modifications, apply to and in relation to the vessel as if it were an abandoned vessel.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Beaching, etc. of local vessel

subsection.leadIn: Where a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is on fire;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has suffered damage by fire, explosion or collision; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is disabled, stranded or out of control because of damage, bad weather or mechanical failure,

subsection.continued: the Director may, if he has reasonable grounds to believe that any of the circumstances specified in subsection (2) prevail, direct the owner of the vessel, his agent or the coxswain—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to beach the vessel;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: to take the vessel outside the limits of a port; or

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: to take such other action as the Director thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances for the purpose of subsection (1) are that the vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is, or is likely to become, a danger to life to other vessels, aircraft or navigation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is causing, or is likely to cause, pollution of the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is causing, or is likely to cause, damage to port facilities or other property.

subsection.content: If without reasonable excuse any direction given under subsection (1) is not complied with, the owner of the vessel, his agent or the coxswain to whom the direction is given commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Removal, etc. of stranded, abandoned or sunken vessels

subsection.content: The Director may give to the owner, his agent or the coxswain of, or other person who claims or appears to the Director to exercise control over, a local vessel which is stranded, abandoned or sunk in the waters of Hong Kong such directions as he thinks fits in respect of the removal, movement, anchoring, mooring, securing, raising or destruction of the vessel.

If without reasonable excuse any direction given under subsection (1) is not complied with, the person to whom the direction is given commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may seize and detain a vessel referred to in subsection (1) together with any cargo and other things on board if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a direction given under subsection (1) is not complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after reasonable inquiry he is unable to ascertain the ownership of the vessel or to trace the owner of the vessel, his agent or the coxswain; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no person claims or appears to the Director to exercise control over the vessel.

subsection.content: For the purposes of seizing a vessel, cargo or other things under subsection (3), the Director may take, or cause to be taken, any action that is necessary including the employment of pilots and the use of tugs and equipment to remove, move, anchor, moor, secure or raise the vessel, cargo and other things.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall publish in the Gazette and in a Chinese language newspaper and an English language newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong a notice of a seizure effected under subsection (3) and the notice shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names (if known to the Director) of the persons whom the Director believes to be the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name (if known to the Director) of the person whom the Director believes to be the owner or otherwise entitled to the possession of any cargo or other things on board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a description of the vessel and the place at which it was seized;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a description of the cargo or other things on board; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a reasonable period within which and the place at which a claim shall be submitted to the Director for the release of the vessel, cargo or other things on board.

subsection.content: If a valid claim to a vessel, cargo or other things seized under subsection (3) is submitted at any time before a notice is published under subsection (5) or within the period specified in a notice published under that subsection, the Director shall, on payment to him of all expenses involved in the seizure and custody of the vessel, cargo or other things, as the case may be, release the vessel, cargo or other things to the claimant.

If the release of a vessel, cargo or other things is not obtained in pursuance of subsection (6), the Director may sell, or otherwise dispose of in such manner as he thinks fit, the vessel, cargo or other things, as the case may be, and in the case of sale the proceeds, after deducting all expenses payable under subsection (6) and any reasonable expense incurred in the sale, shall be paid to the person making a valid claim thereto within 1 year after the date of sale or forfeited to the Government if not claimed within that period.

Without prejudice to any action which may be taken under subsections (6) and (7), the Director may recover the cost of any action taken or caused to be taken under this section including all disbursements and other expenses incurred thereby by the Director as a civil debt from the owner (if known to the Director).

part.name: P11
part.heading: Duties to Report Collisions and Fires, etc.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Duty to report collisions, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where, within the waters of Hong Kong or elsewhere—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel is involved in a collision with another vessel, a port facility or other property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a local vessel sinks or becomes stranded or disabled;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person is killed or seriously injured on board a local vessel as a result of an accident;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an explosion or fire occurs on board a local vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: damage is caused by a local vessel to a port facility or other property; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a person, cargo or equipment is lost overboard from a local vessel,

subsection.continued: the owner of the vessel, his agent or the coxswain shall report the occurrence forthwith to the Director orally, by means of signals, or in writing and shall furnish to the Director in writing full particulars thereof within 24 hours after the occurrence.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes a report or furnishes any particulars under subsection (1) which he knows to be false in any material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: For the purpose of subsection (1)(c), a person shall be deemed to be seriously injured if he is admitted to a hospital immediately after he sustains the injury for observation or treatment.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Duty to report fires on local vessel

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fire occurs on board a local vessel within the waters of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a local vessel which is on fire arrives within the waters of Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: the owner of the vessel, his agent or the coxswain shall report such occurrence or arrival forthwith to the Director of Fire Services.

subsection.content: The Director of Fire Services and any member of the Fire Services Department of or above the rank of Principal Fireman may, at any time of day or night, board any local vessel in the waters of Hong Kong for the purpose of extinguishing a fire on board the vessel whether or not the fire has been reported to the Director of Fire Services, and may take with him such persons as may be necessary to assist him for such purpose.
The owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Compliance by owner, agent or coxswain
section.leadIn: Where by or under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any obligation or duty is placed on the owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain of a local vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any direction is given to the owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain of a local vessel; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain of a local vessel is required to comply with any requirement,

section.continued: it shall, except where it is otherwise expressly provided, be sufficient if such obligation or duty, direction or requirement is met or complied with either by the owner of the vessel, his agent or the coxswain of the vessel.

part.name: P12
part.heading: Powers of Authorized Officers and Investigating Officers

section.name: s60
section.heading: Powers of authorized officers

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to any other provisions of this Ordinance, an authorized officer may, at any time of day or night, stop and board any local vessel for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspecting or searching the vessel or any part thereof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: investigating any occurrence specified in section 57(1), whether or not such occurrence has been reported to the Director under that section;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: making such examination and investigation as may be necessary where any provisions of this Ordinance has been contravened in respect of the vessel or by any person on board the vessel, or where an authorized officer has reasonable grounds for suspecting that such contravention has taken place;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: directing the conduct of any other authorized officer who may be on board the vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: observing, inspecting or searching any person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the time being on board the vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: employed, engaged or dwelling on board the vessel; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: employed or engaged in loading or unloading the vessel; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: taking any action which he considers necessary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to provide against fire or accident on board the vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to preserve peace and good order on board the vessel; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to prevent or detect any offence under this Ordinance or any other enactment in respect of the vessel or by any person on board the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Any police officer of or above the rank of Sergeant may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: take into custody and remove from any local vessel in the waters of Hong Kong any person whom he suspects on reasonable grounds of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: having committed an offence under this Ordinance or any other enactment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: having boarded, or remained on board, the vessel without the permission of the owner of the vessel, his agent or the coxswain of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct a local vessel, in respect of which he suspects on reasonable grounds that an offence under this Ordinance or any other enactment has been committed, to proceed together with any persons on board to the nearest Marine Police Base or Marine Office.

subsection.content: An authorized officer boarding a local vessel under subsection (1) may take with him such persons as may be necessary to assist him for the purposes of this section.

The coxswain of a local vessel, when required to stop the vessel by an authorized officer in the exercise of his powers under subsection (1), shall stop the vessel and permit the authorized officer to board the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Any coxswain who without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (2)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes subsection (4),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Powers of investigating officers

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), for the purpose of any investigation by an inspector under section 40 or by an authorized officer under section 60, an inspector or authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require that a local vessel which he has boarded or any part of it, or anything therein, shall be left undisturbed (whether generally or in particular respects) for so long as is necessary to carry out the investigation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take such measurements and photographs and make such recordings as he considers necessary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inspect, seize and remove from the vessel any article or substance in respect of which he suspects on reasonable grounds that an offence under this Ordinance has been committed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any article or substance removed under paragraph (c), detain it for so long as is necessary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to examine it and to cause it to be subjected to any process or test;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to ensure that it is not tampered with before the examination of it is completed;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to ensure that it is available for use as evidence in any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: require any person whom he has reasonable cause to believe to be able to give any information relevant to the investigation to answer (in the absence of persons other than a person nominated by him to be present and any persons whom the inspector or authorized officer may allow to be present) such questions as the inspector or authorized officer thinks fit to ask and to sign a declaration of the truth of his answers;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: require the production of, inspect, and take copies of any entry in, the log book of the vessel or any document (including an identity card) which it is necessary for him to see for the purposes of the investigation.

subsection.content: No answer given by a person in pursuance of a requirement imposed under subsection (1)(e) shall be admissible in evidence against that person or the spouse of that person in any proceedings.
For the purpose of an investigation under section 40, the powers of an inspector shall be limited to matters to which Part VIII relates or to offences under that Part.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes any requirement imposed by an inspector or authorized officer under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevents any other person from appearing before an inspector or authorized officer or from answering any question to which an inspector or authorized officer may by virtue of subsection (1)(e) require an answer,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Powers of authorized officers to enter premises, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, an authorized officer may, on producing, if so required, some duly authenticated document showing his authority, enter any premises, other than domestic premises, at any time between the hours of 7 a.m. and 7 p.m. for the purposes of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ascertaining whether there is, or has been, on the premises, any local vessel that appears to be or to have been possessed or used in contravention of any of the provisions of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: taking any action authorized or required to be taken by or under this Ordinance in respect of any such vessel found on the premises.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may, if satisfied by information on oath that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: admission to any premises, other than domestic premises, has been refused or that refusal is apprehended, or that such premises are unoccupied, or that the occupier is temporarily absent, or that the case is one of urgency, or that an application for admission would defeat the object of the entry, or that it is reasonable for the purposes of this Ordinance in the circumstances of the case that entry be effected between the hours of 7 p.m. and 7 a.m.; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is reasonable ground for entry into the premises for any of the purpose of subsection (1),

subsection.continued: issue a warrant authorizing an authorized officer to effect entry, if need be by force:
subsection.proviso: Provided that such warrant shall not be issued unless the magistrate is satisfied that notice of the intention to apply for a warrant has been given to the occupier of the premises, or that the premises are unoccupied, or that the occupier is temporarily absent, or that the case is one of urgency, or that the giving of such notice would defeat the object of the entry, or that it is reasonable for the purposes of this Ordinance in the circumstances of the case that entry be effected between the hours of 7 p.m. and 7 a.m. as may be appropriate.

content.leadIn: A magistrate may, if satisfied by information on oath that there is reasonable ground for entry into domestic premises for any of the purposes of subsection (1), issue a warrant authorizing an authorized officer to effect entry between the hours of 7 a.m. and 7 p.m., if need be by force:
content.proviso: Provided that such warrant shall not be issued unless the magistrate is satisfied that notice of the intention to apply for a warrant has been given to the occupier of the premises, or that the premises are unoccupied, or that the occupier is temporarily absent, or that the case is one of urgency, or that the giving of such notice would defeat the object of the entry.

subsection.content: Any authorized officer entering any premises by virtue of the provision of subsection (1) or of a warrant issued under subsection (2) or (3) may take with him such persons as may be necessary, and on leaving any unoccupied premises which he has so entered, shall leave such premises as effectually secured against trespassers as he found the same to be at the time of entry.
Every warrant issued under subsection (2) or (3) shall continue in force until the purpose for which the entry is necessary has been satisfied.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Director may require certain information

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a local vessel is involved in any occurrence specified in section 57(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the coxswain, person in charge or person in control of a local vessel is suspected of having committed an offence under this Ordinance involving the use of the vessel,

subsection.continued: the Director may, within 3 months after the occurrence or alleged offence, serve on the owner of the vessel or his agent a written notice requiring him to furnish to the Director, within 21 days after the date of the notice, a written statement signed by the owner or his agent, specifying the name and address of the coxswain, person in charge or person in control of the vessel at the time of the occurrence or alleged offence.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the owner of a local vessel or his agent who fails to comply with a notice served on him under subsection (1) within the time specified in that subsection commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

In proceedings for an offence under subsection (2), it shall be a defence to show that the accused person did not know, and could not with reasonable diligence have ascertained, the name or address of the coxswain, person in charge or person in control of the vessel at the time of the occurrence or alleged offence referred to in subsection (1).
The provisions of this section shall be in addition to and shall not derogate from section 57.

section.name: s63A
section.heading: Director may perform services and surveys, etc.
section.content: The Director may, upon request and payment of a prescribed fee or without request, perform services and surveys and grant facilities relating to local vessels.

section.name: s63B
section.heading: Director may charge fee
section.content: The Director may charge a prescribed fee in respect of the services and surveys performed and facilities granted upon request under section 63A.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Refusal of permission to enter, leave, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions in this Ordinance, the Director may, if he is satisfied that there is reason for doing so, give directions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refusing permission for a local vessel or class, type or description of local vessel to enter or leave the waters of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring the removal of a local vessel or class, type or description of local vessel from the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1) and without prejudice to any of the Director’s powers under this Ordinance, the Director may give directions prohibiting the entry of a local vessel into, or requiring the removal of a local vessel from, the waters of Hong Kong if in his opinion the condition of that vessel or the nature or condition of anything it contains is such that its presence in the waters of Hong Kong may involve—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grave and imminent danger to the safety of any person or property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: grave and imminent risk that the vessel may, by sinking, foundering or otherwise, prevent or seriously prejudice the use of any part of the waters of Hong Kong by other vessels.

subsection.content: Any directions under subsection (1) or (2) may be given as respects the vessel in question to the owner or the coxswain of the vessel.
At any time any directions under subsection (1) or (2) are given to any person, the Director shall inform that person of the grounds for giving such directions.

If any directions of the Director under subsection (2) were not reasonably necessary to prevent or reduce the danger or risk provided therein, a person incurring expense or suffering damage as a result of any action taken in compliance with the Director’s directions shall be entitled to claim and recover compensation from the Government.
Nothing in this section shall affect the exercise of any powers under section 6 of the Merchant Shipping (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Ordinance (Cap. 413).

If a local vessel which is refused permission under subsection (1)(a) or which is prohibited under subsection (2) to enter the waters of Hong Kong so enters without reasonable excuse, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and to an additional fine of $25,000 for each day during which the vessel remains in the waters of Hong Kong without reasonable excuse after so entering.

If a local vessel which is refused permission under subsection (1)(a) to leave the waters of Hong Kong so leaves without reasonable excuse, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

If without reasonable excuse a direction under subsection (1)(b) or (2) for the removal of a local vessel from the waters of Hong Kong is not complied with, the owner of the vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and to an additional fine of $25,000 for each day during which the vessel remains in the waters of Hong Kong without reasonable excuse.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Dead vessel

subsection.content: No dead vessel shall, except with the permission of the Director, enter, or be brought into, the waters of Hong Kong.

If without reasonable excuse subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the dead vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the dead vessel commit an offence and each of them is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Laid-up vessel

subsection.def: In this section, laid-up vessel (閑置船隻) means any local vessel, other than a dead vessel, which remains or is to remain within the waters of Hong Kong through lack of employment or pending the outcome of any legal proceedings before any court.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), no laid-up vessel shall, except with the written permission of the Director, be berthed, moored or anchored at any place in the waters of Hong Kong.
Subsection (2) shall not apply to a laid-up vessel which is dry-docked or within the precincts of, or berthed or moored alongside, a dockyard.
The Director may attach conditions to a written permission under this section.

Where the Director refuses to grant permission under this section in respect of a laid-up vessel, or attaches conditions to such a permission, he shall serve a notice in writing on the person who sought such permission setting out his reasons for the refusal or conditions, as the case may be.

Where the Director is satisfied that any of the conditions attached to a written permission under this section have been contravened, he may serve a notice in writing on the person who sought such permission revoking the permission and setting out the reasons for the revocation.

If without reasonable excuse subsection (2) is contravened, or any conditions attached under subsection (4) are contravened, the owner of the local vessel, his agent and the coxswain of the vessel commit an offence and each of them is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Recovery of penalty by sale of vessel

subsection.content: Where the owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain of a local vessel who is convicted of an offence under this Ordinance fails to pay any fine imposed in respect of the offence, the Director may sell the vessel in respect of which the offence was committed and apply the proceeds in payment of the fine, and the balance (if any), after deducting any reasonable expense incurred in the sale, shall be paid to the owner of the vessel if claimed within 6 months after the date of the sale or forfeited to the Government if not claimed within that period.

Not less than 14 days before a vessel is sold under subsection (1), the Director shall give to the owner of the vessel or his agent notice in writing of the intended sale, but notice under this subsection shall not be necessary where there is no such owner or agent or the Director is unable to find the owner or agent.

Any vessel sold under this section shall be transferred to the purchaser thereof, at the expense of the purchaser, by a bill of sale from the Director which shall confer upon such purchaser an absolute title to such vessel.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Director may give effect to directions in certain cases

subsection.content: Where a person who is given a direction under this Ordinance fails to comply with it, the Director may, whether or not the person is or will be prosecuted for an offence under this Ordinance, take or cause to be taken such action as may be necessary to give effect to the direction.

Where no person to whom a direction under this Ordinance may be given exists or can be found, the Director may take or cause to be taken such action as he would have directed to be taken if such person existed or could be found.
In a case of emergency affecting the safety of life or property the Director may take or cause to be taken such action as he would have directed to be taken under this Ordinance.

For the purpose of taking any action under this section in respect of any local vessel or property, the Director may board the vessel or enter the property without the permission of the owner of the vessel or his agent or of the coxswain of the vessel, or the owner or occupier of the property, as the case may be, and take with him such persons as may be necessary to assist him for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may recover the cost of any action taken or caused to be taken under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as a civil debt from the person to whom the direction (if any) was given, or the owner of the vessel or property in respect of which the action was taken; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the cost incurred in respect of a vessel cannot for any reason be recovered under paragraph (a) or where there is no owner of the vessel, by sale of the vessel and applying the proceeds in payment of the cost and the balance (if any), after deducting any reasonable expense incurred in the sale, shall be paid to the person who satisfies the Director that he is entitled to the balance.

subsection.content: For the purpose of subsection (5), the cost of any action taken or caused to be taken under this section shall include all disbursements and other expenses incurred thereby by the Director.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Director’s general power of exemption

subsection.content: The Director may, on application made to him in the specified form or on his own initiative, by notice in writing exempt any person or any local vessel or any class, type or description of local vessel from any requirement under this Ordinance, subject to such conditions as the Director may specify in the notice.
Where a person without reasonable excuse fails to comply with any condition specified in a notice under subsection (1), he commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that a notice under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Director’s permission to do restricted acts

subsection.leadIn: Where it is provided under this Ordinance that no person shall do, or cause or permit to be done, any specified act without the permission of the Director, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application made to him in such manner as he may determine; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on payment to him of the prescribed fee (if any),

subsection.continued: permit the specified act to be done subject to such conditions as he may specify generally or in any particular case.

subsection.content: Except where this Ordinance provides for a written permission, a permission under this Ordinance may be granted orally or by means of signals.

subsection.leadIn: A written permission granted under this Ordinance shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: kept on the local vessel or at the place in which the act in respect of which the permission is required is being done; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produced for inspection by the Director, an authorized officer, or by any other officer appointed for the purposes of this Ordinance, on demand or within such time and at such place as the Director or such officer may specify.

subsection.content: If any person to whom a written permission is granted under this Ordinance without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (3)(a) or to produce it under subsection (3)(b), he commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: A permission granted under this Ordinance may be withdrawn or cancelled by the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if any condition of the permission is not complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Director considers it necessary to do so for any other reason.

subsection.content: Where a person without reasonable excuse fails to comply with any condition of a permission granted under this Ordinance, he commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Power of Director to specify forms

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Director may specify the form of any document required under this Ordinance to be in the specified form and the form of such other documents required for the purposes of this Ordinance as he thinks fit.

The Director’s power under subsection (1) shall be subject to any express requirement under this Ordinance for a form, whether specified or otherwise, to comply with that requirement, but that requirement shall not restrict the exercise of that power in respect of that form to the extent that, in the opinion of the Director, his exercise of that power in respect of that form does not contravene that requirement.

subsection.leadIn: The Director’s power under subsection (1) may be exercised in such a way as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include in the specified form of any document referred to in that subsection a statutory declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be made by the person completing the form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to whether the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of that person’s knowledge and belief;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify 2 or more forms of any document referred to in that subsection, whether as alternatives, or to provide for particular circumstances or particular cases, as the Director thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with such directions and instructions as are specified in the form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by such documents as are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the completed form is required to be provided to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Director;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: another person on behalf of the Director; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other person,

paragraph.continued: so provided in the manner, if any, specified in the form.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Delegation by Director

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the Director may, either generally or in any particular case, delegate to any other public officer the performance or exercise on his behalf of any of the functions or powers imposed or conferred upon him under this Ordinance.

Where any function or power imposed or conferred on the Director under this Ordinance is performed or exercised by any other public officer, the Director shall, unless the contrary is proved, be deemed to have delegated to the public officer under subsection (1) the performance or exercise of the function or power.

subsection.leadIn: No delegation under subsection (1) shall be made of any power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to amend a Schedule to the regulations made under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under this Ordinance to make regulations; (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 13)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: under section 69, except in respect of a provision specified in writing for the purposes of this section by the Secretary for Transport and Logistics; or (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; 24 of 2005 s. 13; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to make or grant exemptions under any regulations made under section 89(1)(zh)(i) or (4)(c), except in respect of a provision specified in writing for the purposes of this section by the Secretary for Transport and Logistics. (Added 24 of 2005 s. 13; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)

section.name: s73
section.heading: Improvement notices

subsection.leadIn: Where the Director is of the opinion that a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is contravening a requirement under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has contravened such a requirement in circumstances that make it likely that the contravention will continue or be repeated,

subsection.continued: he may serve on him a notice stating that he is of that opinion, specifying the requirement as to which he is of that opinion, giving particulars of the reasons why he is of that opinion, and directing that person to remedy the contravention or, as the case may be, the matters occasioning it within such period (ending not earlier than the period within which an appeal against that direction may be made under section 87) as is specified in that notice.

subsection.leadIn: An improvement notice may include instructions as to the measures to be taken to remedy any contravention or matter to which such notice relates, and any such instructions may be framed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to any extent by reference to any code of practice approved under section 8; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so as to afford the person on whom the notice is served a choice between different ways of remedying such contravention or matter.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), a direction specified in an improvement notice shall take effect immediately or on such later date, if any, as is specified in such notice, notwithstanding that an appeal has been or may be made under section 87 against such direction.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appeal is made under section 87 against a direction specified in an improvement notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the matter to which such direction relates is not an imminent danger to any person or property,

subsection.continued: the Director shall suspend that part of such notice which contains such direction upon such terms as he thinks fit and, for that purpose, the Director shall have such powers as are necessary to give effect to that suspension.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Ancillary provisions in relation to improvement notices

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 73(2), an improvement notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may include instructions as to repairs or alterations to be effected to a local vessel (whether constructed before, on or after the commencement* of this section) the subject of the contravention or matter to which the notice relates if, but only if, the Director states in the notice that he is satisfied that the repairs or alterations are necessary—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: to remove or abate the effect of alterations which have been made to the vessel—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: since the vessel was last surveyed under this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: without the Director’s approval in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall, where paragraph (a) is applicable, afford the person on whom the notice is served the choice of decommissioning the vessel as an alternative to effecting the repairs or alterations.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person on whom an improvement notice is served to which subsection (1) applies fails to effect the repairs or alterations to, or to decommission, the local vessel the subject of the contravention or matter to which the notice relates, then the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may, with or without notice to the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: effect the repairs or alterations to the vessel; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: decommission the vessel until such time, if any, as the repairs or alterations are effected;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall, where paragraph (a)(ii) is applicable, prominently display on or near the vessel a notice, in the Chinese and English languages—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: stating that the vessel has been decommissioned by the Director under this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: setting out the provisions of subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: No person shall without the consent in writing of the Director—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: remove or mark, or damage or destroy, a notice referred to in subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Where under subsection (2)(a) the Director has effected any repairs or alterations to, or the decommissioning of, a local vessel, the expenses thereof shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be borne by the person on whom the improvement notice concerned was served;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be recoverable from the person as a civil debt due to the Government.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (3)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $2,000.
Any person who contravenes subsection (3)(b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Director to be allowed to board

subsection.content: The coxswain of a local vessel shall allow and assist the Director to board the vessel as soon as he comes alongside the vessel and shall give to the Director such information as he may be required to give under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Any coxswain or crew member of a local vessel who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to allow, or fails to assist, the Director to board the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delays or impedes the Director from boarding the vessel,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Proof of identity of coxswain, etc. in proceedings
section.leadIn: If, in any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance involving a local vessel, there is produced to the court or a magistrate a statement furnished under section 63 which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purports to have been signed by the accused person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: states that the accused person was the coxswain, person in charge or person in control of the vessel at the time of the offence,

section.continued: the court or magistrate shall admit the statement as prima facie evidence that the accused person was the coxswain, person in charge or person in control of the vessel at the time of the offence.

section.name: s76A
section.heading: Proof of identity of agent in proceedings
section.content: If, in any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance involving any person appointed as an agent for the owner of a local vessel, there is produced to the court or a magistrate a notice of appointment signed by the owner and the person so appointed, the court or magistrate shall admit the notice as prima facie evidence that the person was the agent for the owner at the time of the offence.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Use of official log book, etc. in evidence

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings for a contravention of this Ordinance, any entry in the official log book, if any, of a local vessel, deck log book, engine room log book or other similar document, or a document purporting to be a copy of any such entry and to be certified as a true copy by any person specified in subsection (2), shall, until the contrary is proved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be admitted in evidence and be sufficient evidence of the matters stated therein; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of such a copy, be presumed that it is so certified.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of subsection (1), the persons who may certify copies of entries in an official log book, deck log book, engine room log book or other similar document are—

paragraph.name: a
