paragraph.content: the Director or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a magistrate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a notary public, as defined in the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159).

section.name: s78
section.heading: False information
section.content: Without prejudice to any other provisions of this Ordinance, any person who, being required to give any information to the Director or any other person under this Ordinance, fails without reasonable excuse to give such information or gives any information, whether in writing, orally or otherwise, which he knows to be false or misleading as to a material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Penalty for fraudulent use
section.content: Without prejudice to any other provisions of this Ordinance, any person who fraudulently alters or uses, or permits to be fraudulently altered or used, a document issued under this Ordinance, or a duplicate of any such document, commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Obstruction

subsection.content: Any person who obstructs the Director, or any other person, performing or exercising any function or power under this Ordinance commits an offence and, subject to subsection (2), is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
The owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain of a local vessel who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Notice to appear before magistrate in respect of offences

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 8 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), if an officer of the Marine Department of the rank of Marine Inspector Class II or above reasonably suspects that an offence under this Ordinance has been committed by the coxswain of a local vessel such officer may serve on the coxswain personally or by handing the same personally to the senior officer on board the vessel or to the person appearing to be in charge or command of the vessel at the time of such service a notice requiring the coxswain to appear before a magistrate to be dealt with according to law.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be signed by the officer by whom it is served; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: shall state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of the coxswain upon whom it is served and the name of the vessel of which he is the coxswain;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the offence which is alleged to have been committed with sufficient particulars thereof;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the time and place at which the offence is alleged to have been committed; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the time and place at which the coxswain on whom the notice is served is required to appear.

subsection.content: If the coxswain upon whom a notice under subsection (1) has been served fails to appear before a magistrate at the time and place mentioned in the notice, and it is made to appear to the magistrate by oath that the notice was served on the coxswain personally or was handed personally to the senior officer or the person in charge or command of the vessel in accordance with subsection (1), the magistrate may issue a warrant for the apprehension of the coxswain and to bring the coxswain before him or another magistrate to be dealt with according to law duly endorsed as to the amount of bail, if any, upon which the coxswain may be released in the meantime.

If the coxswain upon whom a notice under subsection (1) has been served appears before a magistrate in accordance with the notice, or is brought before a magistrate by a warrant issued under subsection (3), the magistrate may hear and determine the offence alleged in the notice as if a complaint had been made or an information had been laid against the coxswain in respect of the offence and for such purposes, the provisions of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227) relating to the hearing of a complaint or information and the proceedings thereon shall apply with all necessary modifications.

If the coxswain upon whom a notice under subsection (1) has been served is brought before a magistrate by a warrant issued under subsection (3), the magistrate may, in addition to any other penalty, order the coxswain to pay costs, of not more than $400, solely in respect of the warrant.
Any costs ordered to be paid under subsection (5) shall be recoverable under section 14 of the Costs in Criminal Cases Ordinance (Cap. 492) as a civil debt due to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), a magistrate may permit a representative to appear on behalf of a coxswain upon whom a notice under subsection (1) has been served where such representative satisfies the magistrate that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the coxswain has left Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is authorized to enter a plea of guilty on behalf of the coxswain; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he is himself authorized and financially able to pay any fine imposed within 7 days or such longer time as the magistrate may allow.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Time limit for prosecution of offences
section.content: Notwithstanding anything in the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings in respect of an offence under this Ordinance may be brought at any time within 2 years next after the commission of the offence or within 6 months after the first discovery thereof by the prosecutor, whichever period expires first.

section.name: s82A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XIVA
section.def: e-document database (電子文件資料庫) means an electronic database that is maintained or managed by or for the Director;

listed document (表列文件) means—(a)a document listed in column 2 of the Table in Part 2 of Schedule 1 that is referred to in a provision listed in column 3 of that Table corresponding to the document; or(b)a document listed in column 2 of that Table the subject matter of which is referred to in a provision listed in column 3 of that Table corresponding to the document.

section.name: s82B
section.heading: Listed documents may be issued or granted electronically

subsection.content: A listed document that may be issued or granted by a relevant authority under a provision of this Ordinance may be issued or granted by the relevant authority in electronic form.
A relevant authority must cause a listed document issued or granted by the relevant authority in electronic form under subsection (1) to be kept in the e-document database.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant authority (相關當局) means—(a)the Director; or(b)an authorized surveyor.

section.name: s82C
section.heading: Listed documents may be endorsed electronically

subsection.content: A listed document that may be endorsed by the Director under a provision of this Ordinance may be endorsed by the Director in electronic form.
The Director must cause an endorsement made by the Director in electronic form under subsection (1) to be entered in the e-document database with respect to the listed document.

section.name: s82D
section.heading: Validity of listed documents may be suspended electronically

subsection.content: A listed document the validity of which may be suspended by the Director under a provision of this Ordinance may be suspended by the Director in electronic form.

If the validity of a listed document is suspended in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for delivering up or returning the document on the suspension of its validity is regarded as having been met and physical delivery or return of the document is no longer required.
The Director must cause a suspension made by the Director in electronic form under subsection (1) to be entered in the e-document database with respect to the listed document.

section.name: s82E
section.heading: Validity of listed documents may be restored electronically

subsection.content: A listed document the validity of which may be restored by the Director under a provision of this Ordinance may be restored by the Director in electronic form.

If the validity of a listed document is restored in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for returning the document on the restoration of its validity is regarded as having been met and physical return of the document is no longer required.
The Director must cause a restoration made by the Director in electronic form under subsection (1) to be entered in the e-document database with respect to the listed document.

section.name: s82F
section.heading: Listed documents may be cancelled, revoked or withdrawn electronically

subsection.content: A listed document that may be cancelled, revoked or withdrawn by the Director under a provision of this Ordinance may be cancelled, revoked or withdrawn by the Director in electronic form.

If a listed document is cancelled, revoked or withdrawn in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for delivering up or returning the document on its cancellation, revocation or withdrawal is regarded as having been met and physical delivery or return of the document is no longer required.

The Director must cause a cancellation, revocation or withdrawal made by the Director in electronic form under subsection (1) to be entered in the e-document database with respect to the listed document.

section.name: s82G
section.heading: Specified plans may be submitted or forwarded electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a specified plan that is required to be submitted to a relevant authority, or forwarded by a relevant authority to a specified applicant, under a provision of this Ordinance.
A specified plan may be submitted to a relevant authority in electronic form in a manner the Director specifies.
A specified plan may be forwarded by a relevant authority to a specified applicant in electronic form.

If 1 copy of a specified plan is submitted or forwarded in electronic form under this section, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for submitting or forwarding more than one copy of the plan is regarded as having been met and the submission or forwarding of more than one copy of the plan is no longer required.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Cap. 548G (《第548G章》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Safety and Survey) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. G);
relevant authority (相關當局) means—(a)the Director; or(b)a competent surveyor as defined by section 2 of Cap. 548G;
specified applicant (指明申請人) means an applicant of an application under section 8(1) of Cap. 548G;
specified plan (指明圖則)—(a)means a plan referred to in section 9(1) of Cap. 548G; and(b)includes any booklet that is included in the plan;
submit (呈交) includes resubmit.

section.name: s82H
section.heading: Keeping and producing listed documents electronically by making them available for viewing from electronic device on board or at relevant place

subsection.leadIn: If the keeping, or production for inspection, of a listed document, or a copy of the document, on board the local vessel, or at a relevant place, to which the document relates is required under a provision of this Ordinance, the requirement is also met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by making the document readily accessible for viewing from an electronic device—

subparagraph.content: if the provision requires the keeping, or production for inspection, of the document or copy on board the vessel—on board the vessel; or
if the provision requires the keeping, or production for inspection, of the document or copy at the relevant place—at the relevant place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: (for a listed document other than a local certificate of competency) if the device is not functioning properly—by producing a printout of the document in electronic form—

subparagraph.content: if the provision requires the keeping, or production for inspection, of the document or copy on board the vessel—on board the vessel; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (for a listed document that is a local certificate of competency) if the device is not functioning properly or if the device is not available—by producing a printout of the document in electronic form on board the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: printout (打印本) includes a copy of a printout;
relevant place (相關地方), in relation to a listed document that is evidence of any permission granted by the Director for a person to do an act at a place, means the place.

section.name: s82I
section.heading: Power of Secretary for Transport and Logistics to amend Schedule 1

subsection.content: The Secretary for Transport and Logistics may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1.

A notice published under subsection (1) may contain any incidental, supplementary, consequential, savings or transitional provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of the amendments made under that subsection.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive to give directions

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may give to the Director and to any public officer such directions as he thinks fit, either generally or in any particular case, with respect to the performance or the exercise of their functions or powers under this Ordinance.

A person to whom a direction is given by the Chief Executive under subsection (1) shall, in the performance or the exercise of his functions or powers under this Ordinance, comply with that direction.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Giving of directions and offence of non-compliance

subsection.content: A direction given under this Ordinance may be given orally or in writing, or by means of signals.
If requested by any person who is given a direction orally or by means of signals the person giving the direction shall confirm the direction in writing.

subsection.leadIn: A direction given under this Ordinance shall be complied with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forthwith; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a time limit for compliance is specified in the direction, within such time limit,

subsection.continued: notwithstanding that the direction has not been confirmed under subsection (2).

subsection.content: Where under this Ordinance a direction may be given to a coxswain of a local vessel it shall be sufficient if the direction is given to a person on board the vessel who is on duty to accept any direction on behalf of the coxswain, and if there is no such coxswain or such coxswain cannot be traced, the direction may be given to the owner of the vessel or his agent or to any other person who appears to the person giving the direction to be in control of the vessel at that time.

The giving of a direction under this Ordinance shall not diminish or in any way affect the responsibility of the coxswain in relation to his vessel, persons on board, its cargo or any other person or property.

Without prejudice to any other express penalty for failure to comply with a direction, any person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a direction given to him under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Service of documents

subsection.leadIn: Where for the purposes of this Ordinance any document is to be served on a person, that document may be served by any officer of the Marine Department of the rank of Marine Inspector Class II or above—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any case by delivering the document personally to the person to be served, or by leaving it for him at his last known place of business or residence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the document is to be served on the coxswain of a local vessel, where there is one, by leaving it for him on board the vessel with the person being or appearing to be in charge or command of the vessel or a member of the crew of the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the document is to be served on a person belonging to a local vessel, by leaving it for him on board the vessel with the coxswain of the vessel or with a person being or appearing to be in charge or command of the vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the document is to be served on the coxswain of a local vessel, where there is no coxswain and the vessel is in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the owner of the vessel or his agent residing in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where no such owner or his agent is known or can be found, by affixing the document to the mast or other prominent part of the vessel;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the document is to be served on the owner of a local vessel or his agent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by leaving it for him at the address of the owner or his agent which is endorsed on the certificate of ownership issued in respect of the vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in respect of a vessel which is not certificated, by leaving the document for him at the office of the owner or his agent (if known), as the case may be, or with some person being or appearing to be in charge of the office;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by leaving the document for him on board the vessel with the coxswain of the vessel, or some person being or appearing to be in charge or command of the vessel or a member of the crew of the vessel.

subsection.content: Any document referred to in subsection (1) which is to be served on the owner of a local vessel, his agent or the coxswain of a local vessel may be addressed to the owner, agent or coxswain, as the case may be, without specifying his name.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Indemnity against damage, etc.
section.content: No action in respect of any damage to property or injury to person shall lie against the Director or any other officer performing or exercising any function or power under section 52, 55, 56 or 68 in good faith.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Appeals
section.leadIn: An appeal may be made to the Administrative Appeals Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: against a decision of the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to refuse to authorize under section 7 a person as a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to attach conditions to an authorization under section 7;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to revoke an authorization under section 7;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: to serve a detention order (which appeal may relate only to the costs specified in the order by virtue of section 52(5)(g));

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: to give a direction under section 53(1)(a);

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: to refuse to comply with a request under section 54(2);

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: to refuse to grant permission under section 66;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: to attach conditions to a permission under section 66;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: to revoke a permission under section 66;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: to give a direction specified in an improvement notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a)(i), the person seeking to be authorized as a surveyor for the purposes of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a)(ii) or (iii), the authorized surveyor concerned;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a)(iv), (v) or (vi), the owner, his agent or a person who appears to exercise control over the local vessel concerned;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a)(vii), (viii) or (ix), the person who sought or was granted, as the case may be, the permission concerned or (if different) the owner of the local vessel concerned, his agent or the coxswain of the local vessel concerned;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a)(x), any person aggrieved by the direction specified in the improvement notice.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Regulations relating to fees

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may by regulation prescribe or provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fees to be paid in respect of the grant of certificates, clearances, licences, permits and other documents, or the performance of services or surveys or grant of facilities under or in connection with this Ordinance; and (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 16)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fees to be paid whenever by or under this Ordinance the official signature of the Director to any certificate, authorization, consent, licence, permit or exemption, or to any alteration, transfer or renewal thereof, addition thereto or endorsement thereon, is requested or required, or wherever a search of any register kept under this Ordinance is granted.

subsection.content: Any fees prescribed under this section may be fixed at levels which provide for the recovery of expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred by the Government or other authority in relation generally to the administration, regulation and control of the matters to which this Ordinance relates, and shall not be limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in the provision of any particular service, facility or matter.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Regulations—general

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Transport and Logistics may make regulations in respect of local vessels for all or any of the following matters— (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the regulation, control, use and speed of vessels;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certification of vessels;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensing of vessels and the renewal of licences, and in the case of vessels that have, contrary to the regulations made under this section, not been licensed for any period, for the payment of licence fees or penalty in respect of the period during which the vessels were not licensed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the cancellation or suspension of certificates or licences;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: empowering an authorized officer to seize and remove or cause to be removed from any place or premises or from any part of the waters of Hong Kong and to detain vessels, without notice to the owners thereof, which he has reason to believe are not certificated or licensed in accordance with regulations made under this section, together with any things on board and any trailer or other device whereby such vessels are transported;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the disposal by way of sale or otherwise of unclaimed vessels or things which have been seized, removed and detained pursuant to regulations made under this section and the payment of the proceeds, if any, of any such disposal into the general revenue;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the design and construction of vessels, the equipment required to be carried on board vessels and matters incidental thereto;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the accommodation for passengers and crew, and means for their safety and escape;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the measures to be taken for the control and prevention of fire and protection of life and property, including specifying the general and specific requirements relating to the life-saving appliances and fire-fighting apparatuses to be provided on vessels, and the training of the crew in the use of such appliances or apparatuses; (Replaced 24 of 2005 s. 17)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the survey, approval of plans or inspection of vessels and the issue (and cancellation) of certificates of survey or inspection; (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 17)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the classification of vessels;

paragraph.name: l
m
paragraph.content: prescribing what signals may be used by vessels as signals of distress;

paragraph.name: n
o
paragraph.content: prescribing the circumstances and manner in which warnings of navigational dangers shall be reported;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: the employment on vessels of a coxswain and deck and engineering crew who possesses local certificates of competency, or certificates of competency recognized as equivalent to local certificates of competency by regulations made under this section;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: the number and grade of crew to be employed on vessels;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: the engagement and discharge of crew, their conditions of employment, and their hours of work and rest periods;

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: the duties of owners, their agents and crew;

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: regulating the noise, vibration and smoke which may be caused by vessels;

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: regulating the hiring of vessels and the carriage of passengers and the plying limits;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to provide anchorages and mooring areas for vessels, and to control and regulate their use;

paragraph.name: va
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to prohibit vessels from anchoring or lying at any place; (Added 24 of 2005 s. 17)

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: the use of piers and the embarkation and disembarkation of persons;

paragraph.name: x
y
paragraph.content: the registration of persons dwelling in any specified type or class of vessels;

paragraph.name: z
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to amend any Schedule to the regulations;

paragraph.name: za
paragraph.leadIn: appeals to the Administrative Appeals Board—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: against any decision of the Director made under the regulations;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by any person aggrieved by any such decision;

paragraph.name: zb
paragraph.content: the establishment of typhoon shelters and typhoon anchorages and the control of their use and the vessels therein;

paragraph.name: zc
paragraph.content: the prohibition or control of fishing within specified areas of the waters of Hong Kong (including empowering the Director to so prohibit or control), the control of fishing by the use of bright lights, and the control of the erection and working of fishing stakes;

paragraph.name: zd
ze
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to control and regulate water sports, races, regattas or other similar activities in the waters of Hong Kong and providing for the safety of persons taking part in, or affected by, such activities;

paragraph.name: zf
paragraph.content: the packaging, marking, loading, placing, moving, inspection, stowing, securing, segregating, testing and measuring of cargo on vessels in the interests of safety of vessels and persons on them (including the health of such persons);

paragraph.name: zg
paragraph.leadIn: matters incidental to or relating to the insurance that is required to be taken out under the Ordinance, including but not limited to the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: approve protection and indemnity associations as insurers for the purposes of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: revoke or suspend such approval;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: specify the amount of insurance to be covered by any policy of insurance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conditions and requirements as to the issue or sale of such policies of insurance; (Replaced 24 of 2005 s. 17)

paragraph.name: zh
paragraph.leadIn: the control of works, the control of salvaging of vessels, the control and use of lifting appliances and lifting gear, the safety and protection against accidents of persons employed in such works or operations, the provision of safe workplaces on local vessels, the operation, use and maintenance of hatches and hatch coverings on vessels in connection with works, and regulations made for the purpose of this paragraph may empower the Director to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: make exemptions from the application of the regulations where he is satisfied that the regulations have been substantially complied with or where compliance therewith is unnecessary having regard to the circumstances;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: approve any person to provide a safety training course and issue certificates to any person who attends the course; (Replaced 70 of 1999 s. 27)

paragraph.name: zi
paragraph.content: establishing piers and terminals and controlling their use;

paragraph.name: zj
paragraph.content: the provision of port facilities and control over their use;

paragraph.name: zk
paragraph.content: the procedure to be followed, and the provisions to be complied with, by vessels entering or leaving the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: zl
paragraph.content: the prevention of hazards to navigation and the removal and disposal of objects which are a hazard to navigation;

paragraph.name: zm
zo
paragraph.content: the prevention and control of pollution of the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: zp
paragraph.content: the control of the loading, discharge, storage and movement of logs and other timber in the waters of Hong Kong, and of the loading or discharge of logs and other timber at any public waterfront or public seawall within the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: zq
zqa
zr
paragraph.content: empowering the Director to give directions in any particular case in relation to such matters as may be specified;

paragraph.name: zs
paragraph.content: prescribing any other matter which is to be or may be prescribed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: zt
paragraph.content: generally providing for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Secretary for Transport and Logistics may make regulations providing for the grant, renewal or revocation by the Director of a permit in respect of a vessel referred to in paragraph (e) of the definition of local vessel in section 2 for the regulation, control or use of the vessel. (Replaced 24 of 2005 s. 17. Amended L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this section for the regulation, control, use and licensing of dwelling vessels may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: empower the Director to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: order the removal, within such time as may be prescribed, of any dwelling vessel from any part of the waters of Hong Kong being an area in respect of which a licence is required or being an area declared to be closed to dwelling vessels;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: seize, remove and detain any dwelling vessel in respect of which an order for removal has been made and not complied with;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: remove any person or property found on any dwelling vessel that has been seized and detained;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sell, by public auction or otherwise, any dwelling vessel which has been seized and detained;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: destroy or otherwise dispose of any vessel that has been seized and detained and which he is unable to sell;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: pay any proceeds of sale of a dwelling vessel to the owner thereof, if known, or if the owner is not known or does not claim such proceeds, pay the same into general revenue;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the seizure and disposal of any property found on a dwelling vessel which has been seized and detained and, in particular, may provide that any such property shall become the property of the Government free from the rights of any person and may be disposed of as the Director thinks fit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for the service of an order to remove a dwelling vessel from any part of the waters of Hong Kong by affixing such order to a prominent part of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Any regulations made under this section may empower the Director to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe, by notice in the Gazette, specifications, standards or additional requirements for the purposes of the regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue instructions or directions providing practical guidance with respect to specifications, standards or requirements prescribed by or under the regulations; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: grant exemptions from the requirements of the regulations, either generally or in any particular case.

subsection.content: Any instructions or directions referred to in subsection (4)(b) and any amendment thereof shall be published in such manner as is specified in the regulations or, if not so specified, in such manner as the person issuing them thinks fit, and such publication shall be notified in the Gazette together with advice as to where copies may be obtained.

subsection.leadIn: Any regulations made under this Ordinance may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for a particular case or class of cases;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply only in such circumstances as are prescribed by the regulations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be made to apply to local vessels wherever they may be;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: authorize, or provide for the authorization of, persons to carry out inspections or other matters required by the regulations;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: be made generally for the better and more effectual carrying out of the provisions of this Ordinance, including incidental, consequential, evidential, transitional and supplemental provisions.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), any regulations made under this Ordinance may include regulations which provide for transitional or savings provisions in respect of any of the enactments repealed or amended by this Ordinance.

Any regulations made under this section may prescribe offences in respect of contraventions of the regulations, and may provide for the imposition in respect of any such offence of a fine not exceeding level 6 and of imprisonment for a period not exceeding 2 years.

section.name: s89A
section.heading: Regulations relating to international agreements applicable to Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Transport and Logistics may make regulations for giving effect (whether in whole or in part) to any provisions of an international agreement applicable to Hong Kong, as amended from time to time, so far as the agreement relates to any of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the safety of navigation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the safety of life at sea;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the protection of life or property on vessels;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the prevention of air pollution or water pollution from vessels.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), any such regulations may, whether in a Schedule or otherwise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: set out or refer directly to those provisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify amendments, modifications or adaptations subject to which those provisions are to have effect.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Saving, etc. of certain regulations

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collision regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the use of signals of distress regulations,

section.continued: shall, except in so far as they are inconsistent with any of the provisions of this Ordinance or any regulations made thereunder—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: each continue in operation for the purposes of this Ordinance until such time as they are replaced by regulations made under section 89 which are expressed to be in substitution of those regulations; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: each be deemed for all purposes to have been made under section 89 and to be liable to amendment thereby or thereunder.

section.name: s90A
section.heading: Saving of notices made under the pre-amended regulation 41(2)(f) of the Shipping and Port Control Regulations

subsection.leadIn: A notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made under the pre-amended regulation 41(2)(f) of the Shipping and Port Control Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. A); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in force immediately before the commencement* of section 48 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels and Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2005 (24 of 2005) in respect of a place,

subsection.continued: shall be treated as a notice prohibiting any vessel from anchoring or lying at that place posted under any regulation made in relation to the prohibition under section 89.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to the pre-amended regulation 41(2)(f) of the Shipping and Port Control Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. A) shall be construed as a reference to that section in force immediately before the commencement of section 48 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels and Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2005 (24 of 2005).

section.name: s91
section.heading: Transitional provisions

subsection.leadIn: Where, immediately before the relevant day, there was in existence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an application—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for a licence within the meaning of section 24 of the former Part; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which had not been determined;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an application—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for a local certificate of competency within the meaning of section 24 of the former Part; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which had not been determined,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of an application referred to in paragraph (a), the application shall be deemed to be an application to be certificated and licensed;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in the case of an application referred to in paragraph (b), the application shall be deemed to be an application for a local certificate of competency,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: A former licence shall be deemed to be a certificate of ownership and an operating licence in respect of the local vessel to which it relates until the expiration of the period of validity it had left to run immediately before the relevant day, and the provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that subsection (4) shall not operate to prevent a former licence from being amended, or cancelled, revoked or suspended, or being subject to any similar action, pursuant to the provisions of this Ordinance.
A former local certificate of competency shall be deemed to be a local certificate of competency of the same class and grade, and the provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 30(2) of the former Part as read with section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), where a local certificate of competency within the meaning of section 24 of the former Part is, immediately before the relevant day, under suspension under section 30 of the former Part, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the certificate shall be deemed to be a local certificate of competency suspended under Part V on and from the relevant day until the date on which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the period of suspension left to serve expires; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the suspension is lifted by an order under section 30(2) of the former Part,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on that date, subsection (6) shall apply to the certificate accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Where, on the commencement* of section 12, the owner of a local vessel is an individual who does not hold a valid identity card, then—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to any other provisions of this Ordinance under which the Director may refuse to certificate the vessel, the Director shall refuse to certificate the vessel if, after the expiration of that period, the owner of the vessel is an individual who does not hold such a card.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former licence (先前的牌照) means a licence within the meaning of section 24 of the former Part and in force immediately before the relevant day;
former local certificate of competency (先前的本地合格證書) means a local certificate of competency within the meaning of section 24 of the former Part and in force immediately before the relevant day;
former Part (先前的第IV部) means Part IV of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313) repealed by this Ordinance;
relevant day (有關日期) means the day of commencement# of this section.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Cap. 548F (《第548F章》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (General) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. F);
Cap. 548G (《第548G章》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Safety and Survey) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. G).

document to evidence the written permission for a laid-up vessel
notice in writing to evidence the exemption from any requirement under this Ordinance
document to evidence the permission to do, or cause or permit to be done, restricted acts
document to evidence the permission for conducting a seatrial
